loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 49 years old and married with 5 children.  Antonieta works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Antonieta has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.  Antonieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.  NWTF is relisting Maria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 46 years old and married with 4 children.  Nelita works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell.

Nelita has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.  Nelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Josephine has been in this business for 30 years.  Josephine earns more income from a sari-sari store.  Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 49 years old and married with 12 children.  With 7 children in school, Florenda works very hard to provide for them.  Florenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Florenda has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, etc.. In the future Florenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 53 years old and married with 4 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Theresa has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from food and vegetable vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zaytuna

texts.en:
Zaytuna is 34 years old.  She is an industrious woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is a widow and has 2 children.  She wants to comfort them with all modern conveniences and with this aim she began her own business of selling of childrens clothes.  She has wide assortment and it attracts a lot of customers.  She sells her goods at the local market which is situated in the center of her region.  She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. 

Currently, her elder son helps her to purchase her goods.  As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business by selling new seasonal clothing.

This is her first loan with Imon International organization and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy goods for new season.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes for new season

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support 3 children.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Lilia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Lucilda

texts.en:
Lucilda works hard to support her family.  Lucilda is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Lucilda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell to customers.  Lucilda has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lucilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to customers

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene veintidós años de trabajar en la agricultura desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia que le permite mejorar cada vez mas su labor, adicional a esto posee una tienda en su vivienda y eso le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona apta para la siembra, muy accesible y con suelo fértil, toda la producción la comercia desde su tienda y en algunos otros establecimientos, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que el producto es de calidad y a precios bajos además de un buen servicio Rolando se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad; él es un hombre admirable entregado a su labor y a su familia siempre esta buscando nuevas oportunidades que le abran puertas para alcanzar un futuro mejor, en la ultima cosecha no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y quiere recuperarse pero necesita aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, herbicida, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Rolando tiene buenas referencias de crédito, por lo tanto asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda  en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo tiene confianza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Rolando is forty six years old and lives with his life's companion and with his son. He works in agriculture, especially in growing corn and sorghum. He has worked in agriculture for twenty two years. He learned the trade when he was very young and has acquired a lot of experience that allows him to improve his work all the time. In addition to this, he also has a store in his home and this helps him pay for the household expenses. The cropland is located in a area suited for planting. It is very accesible and has fertile soil. He sells all of his product from his store and in some other establishments. He already has a lot of customers because people know that his product is quality and at a low price. In addition to his good service, Rolando is characterized for his great friendliness. He is an admirable man who is dedicated to his work and his family. He is always seeking new opportunities to ppen doors to a better future. In the last harvest he didn't obtain the earnings he was hoping for and he wants to recover but he needs to increase the invetsment. That is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so that he can buy corn and sorghum seeds, herbicide, insecticide, tools, etc. Rolando has good credit references, and he is sure that he can pay off the debt in the established time period. He is also confident that he can offer his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seeds, herbicides, insecticides and tools.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene diez años trabajando en la agricultura, desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y con el tiempo ha ganado experiencia muy valiosa que le ha permitido mejorar en su labor y obtener las mejore ganancias, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en un lugar muy accesible y es apto para la siembra además esta cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, adicional al cultivo también posee una venta de antojitos que le ayuda con los gastos del hogar; Ana María es una mujer admirable, entregada a su labor y muy responsable siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas para salir adelante, ella piensa que mientras mas fuerte trabaja mas grande será su recompensa por eso en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar su producción pero necesita de un respaldo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, abono, insecticida, etc. Ana María tiene buenas referencias crediticias y asegura poder cancelar la deuda y a la vez ofrece darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana María is forty six years old. She lives with her life's companion and her children. She works growing corn and sorghum. She has worked in agriculture for ten years. She learned the trade when she was very young and over time has gained very valuable experience that has allowed her to improve her work and improve her earnings. The cropland is in a very accesible place that is suited for planting. It is also close to her home. She sells in the surrounding areas and she has a lot of customers because people prefer her. They know she has what they need with a product of the best quality at accesible prices. In addition, the service is unequaled. In addition to the crops, she also sells snacks and this helps with the household expenses. Ana María is an admirable woman who is dedicated to her work and very responsible. She is always seeking the best alternatives to get ahead. She thinks that the harder she works the bigger her reward will be. That is why at this planting time she wants to increase her production but she needs support of capital. That is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.  Ana María has good credit references and is sure she can pay off the debt and at the same time offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seeds, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 53 años, junto a su esposo Víctor tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora solo vive con una de ellas, Johana, quien ya trabaja independientemente. La casa donde viven es propia, la compraron hace 7 años.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, ofrece sus productos mediante catálogo y muestras que tiene disponible para sus clientes, es por ello que realiza constantes visitas. También vende ropa, sobre todo importada, “a los clientes le gusta vestir por temporada, ellos disfrutan de tener una prenda única”, afirma. Por ejemplo en épocas de invierno, vende casacas, abrigos, chalinas, gorras, en verano polos, vestidos, pantalones cortos y demás. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años y le es rentable, por lo que ha decidido incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo más y mejores productos.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres unidas” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Se siente satisfecha de su labor, pues gracias al dinero solicitado puede incrementar su mercadería, además de ser una mujer trabajadora, pues logró adquirir más clientela gracias a las enseñanzas que recibe en su grupo.
Elena invertirá este dinero en la compra de casacas para la temporada de invierno, pues ya tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old. With her husband Víctor she has four children. Now she only lives with one of them, Johana, who is already working independently. She owns the house she lives in, which they bought 7 years ago.

The activity she does is selling beauty products. She offers her products via catalogue and with samples that she has available for her customers. She does a lot of visiting.  She also sells clothing, especially imported clothing, “to the customers who like to dress for the season. They like to have a unique item of clothing", she affirms. For example, she sells jackets, coats, shawls, hats.  In summer she sells t-shirts, dresses, pants, shorts and more.  She has had this business for 10 years and it is profitable. That is why she has decided to increase her sales, offering more and better products.

She belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” [United Women] group and this is her fifth loan with MFP. She feels satisfied with her work, because thanks to the money she has asked for she can increase her merchandise. She is also a hardworking woman, and she was able to gain more customers thanks to the teachings she received in her group.

Elena will invest this money in buying jackets for the winter season, because she already has a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy winter jackets to fill her orders.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de cincuenta y tres años de edad  vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene treinta años de trabajar en la agricultura, desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y con el tiempo se ha hecho de experiencia que le h permitido obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es de mucha incidencia agrícola y esta ubicado en una zona con suelo fértil, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, las personas prefieren su producto porque es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es único; Carlos es un hombre emprendedor con mucho entusiasmo de forjarse un futuro mejor, siempre se encuentra en la lucha del alcanzar el éxito y esta haciendo lo posible por lograrlo, en la temporada de siembra pasada tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, pero necesita de capital para la inversión por eso se acercó y le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, abono, etc. Carlos tiene buenas referencias de pago y una buena moral tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda y al mismo tiempo le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Carlos, 53 years old, lives with his life’s companion and children. He cultivates maize and sorghum and has been a farmer for 30 years. He learned the job when he was very young and over time has become very experienced which has enabled him to reap the best harvests. The land he cultivates is good farming land and is located in an area with fertile soil. He markets his crops in all the surrounding areas and has a fixed customer base. People prefer his products because they are the highest quality and he sells at accessible prices and his service is excellent. 

Carlos is an enterprising man who is very enthusiastically creating a better future for himself. You always find him fighting to succeed and doing everything possible to get ahead. During the last planting season he had some losses and wants to recuperate, however he needs the capital to invest. Consequently he came to INTEGRAL to request a loan that will enable him to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, etc. 

Carlos has a good credit history and good morals. He is certain that he will pay off the debt and at the same time give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis Alfonso de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en este rubro y se siente muy orgulloso de toda la experiencia que ha ganado, desde joven aprendió el oficio y siempre procuro obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva es muy accesible cercano a la carretera y con suelo fértil además esta cercano a su vivienda, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todas las comunidades aledañas, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio, adicional al cultivo Luis trabaja de albañil y eso le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar; Él es un hombre enérgico, responsable y muy trabajador siempre esta a la expectativa de oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en esta época de cosecha quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Luis Alfonso tiene buenas recomendaciones de paga y tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que le dará una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso, 41 years old, lives with his life’s companion and children. He dedicates himself to agriculture, specifically the cultivation of maize and beans. He has spent a great deal of time doing this work and is very proud of all the experience he has gained. He learned the job when he was a young man and always manages to obtain the best crops. The land he cultivates is very accessible to the road and has fertile soil and it is also close to his home. Everything he produces he markets in surrounding communities and he has many customers since people know that everything he sells is high quality and at accessible prices. He also offers good service.

In addition to farming, Luis also works as a bricklayer and that helps pay for household expenses. He is an energetic, responsible and very hardworking man. He is always looking for opportunities that will enable him to succeed. During this planting season he wants to increase production but he needs the capital to invest. Consequently he is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will enable him to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. 

Luis Alfonso has a good payment history and is certain that he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time he has faith that he will give his family a fuller life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 29 años, vice en la casa de sus padres, desde hace 4 años, junto a su esposo Darío y sus dos hijos: Enrique y Dayana.  
Su principal ingreso económico lo obtiene de la agricultura, siembra papa, alverja y cebada. Sus terrenos agrícolas se ubican a dos horas de distancia de la ciudad, por lo que pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo junto a su esposo, con quien trabaja. Gracias a su constancia en cada cosecha ya tiene compradores en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde obtiene el pago de tantos meses de esfuerzo. “No solo siembro en la sierra, también tengo terrenos agrícolas en la selva, ahí siembro café y piña, por temporada, el café no necesita mucho cuidado, solo cosecho una vez al año”, comenta. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo pudo aprovechar las oportunidades de desarrollo que se le presentaron, pues tenía el capital necesario gracias a estos préstamos. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que todos los integrantes de su grupo son muy responsables.
Esta vez, Maribel invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para la próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “primeriza”.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 29, has lived with her husband, Darío, and her two children, Enrique and Dayana, in her parents’ house for four years.

She gets her main income from growing potatoes, peas, and barley.   The land she farms is two hours from the city.  Therefore, she spends most of her time with her husband, with whom she works.  Thanks to the constancy of each harvest, she has buyers at the wholesale market in the city.  That is where she gets the payment for so many months of effort.  “I not only grow in the mountains, but I also have farmland in the jungle where I grow seasonal coffee and pineapples.  The coffee does not need much care, and I only harvest it once a year,” she says.

This is her second loan with MFP.  In all of this time she was able to take advantage of opportunities for growth that were presented to her.  She had the needed capital  thanks to these loans.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments because all of the members of her group are very responsible.

This time Maribel will use the loan to buy natural fertilizers for the next planting of the “primeriza” variety of potato.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers for the next potato planting.

loans.name: Maurice Narcisse

texts.fr: Maurice Narcisse est âgé de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Maurice Narcisse a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Maurice Narcisse est marié à un certain Sébastienne. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants et dont certains sont scolarisés. Maurice Narcisse vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Maurice Narcisse vend des céréales (maïs, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Maurice Narcisse s’approvisionne dans sa région. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Maurice Narcisse contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Maurice Narcisse sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Maurice Narcisse ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Maurice Narcisse is 43 years old and lives in Benin. He dropped out of college. He is married to a woman named Sébastienne. The couple have five children to support. Four of the children are their own, some of whom are in school. Maurice Narcisse lives together with his children and wife. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To cope with the diverse household needs, Maurice Narcisse has been selling grains (corn, cassava flour, etc.) out of his home for four years. He gets his supplies in his region. Thanks to the revenues this business generates, he helps with the different household expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of his burgeoning customer base, Maurice Narcisse is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The loans received previously by him were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and cassava flour

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Âgé de 57 ans, Joseph vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Joseph est marié à un certain Louise. Le couple a huit enfants tous scolarisés dont cinq restent à leur charge. Joseph vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les différents besoins du ménage. Joseph mène l'activité de transformation des noix de palme, activité qu’il exerce depuis quinze ans à son domicile et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. En plus de cette activité, Joseph vend des boissons. La clientèle de Joseph devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitif sur le marché, Joseph désire agrandir son activité. Joseph s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Joseph sollicite une sixième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les cinq crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Joseph, aged 57, lives in Benin. He dropped out of secondary school. He is married to a woman named Louise. The couple have eight children, all educated, of whom five still remain in their care. Joseph lives together with his children and wife. Together with her, he ensures that the different household needs are met. 

Joseph has been running a business processing palm nuts for about fifteen years, and he operates in his home. It brings in significant revenues. In addition to this business, Joseph sells drinks. His customer base grows bigger and bigger. To perfect his business and to be competitive in the market, Joseph would like to expand his business. He gets his supplies in his region. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and revenues, Joseph is requesting financial support for the sixth time from ALIDé. The five loans received previously were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts for making palm oil

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 26 años, desde hace un año vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su esposo Elvis y su hijo Nicolás, a quien quiere mucho.  
Aún es joven, esa fortaleza que le da su edad la lleva hacia la realización de muchas actividades. Hace poco compró un auto, con el que su esposo realiza trasporte público, mientras ella se dedica al negocio que por más de 6 años emprendió; la venta de frutas. Compra sus productos con mucho cuidado, pues sabe que sus clientes son exigentes y gustan de frutas frescas y sabrosas. Ella cuenta con puestos de venta en las ferias de tres diferentes localidades donde paga el alquiler anual a comienzos de año. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar de manera puntual, además le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal porque le enseñan cómo administrar su dinero.
Sonia invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 15 millares de naranjas para su venta.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old and has been living in a rented house with her husband, Elvis, and son, Nicolás, whom she loves dearly.

Although she is young, the strength her age provides enables her to carry out many activities. A short while ago she bought a car with which her husband provides transportation to the public, while she has a business that she started more than 6 years ago: she sells fruit. She buys her products very carefully since she knows her customers are demanding and like fresh, delicious fruit. She has sales stalls at markets in three different localities where she pays the rent annually at the beginning of the year.

This is her first loan from MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually. In addition, she enjoys very much working with her communal bank because it is teaching her how to manage her money. 

Sonia will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of 15 thousands oranges to sell.

loans.use: to buy 15 thousand oranges to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa tiene 61 años, está casada y tiene seis hijos. Actualmente solo vive al lado de su yerno y su nieto, en la casa que compró hace 25 años.
Sufrió la muerte de sus cuatro hijos y enviudó hace 6 años, más todas las pruebas que pasó en la vida no la desmotivaron, pues aún nietos y dos hijos que la quieren mucho y necesitan. Su principal actividad económica en la compra y venta de queso, ya tiene 40 años dedicándose a este oficio. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de queso de una zona productora que está a 4 horas desde la ciudad, los compra y los trae a vender a la ciudad a un mayor precio, y también tiene compradores específicos donde les lleva el queso tres veces a la semana.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y en todo este tiempo pudo aprovechar las oportunidades de desarrollo que se le presentaron porque tenía el capital necesario, gracias a estos préstamos; por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Felipa invertirá este dinero en la compra de 100 quesos para abastecer a los clientes que tiene en las diferentes ciudades.
texts.en:
Felipa, age 61, is married and has six children.  She now lives only with her son-in-law and her grandson.  They live in the house she bought 25 years ago.

She suffered the death of four of her children, and she has been widowed for six years.  Add to this all of life’s tests she has experienced, and none of these events discouraged her.  She still has grandchildren and two children who love her a lot and need her.  

Her main business activity is buying and selling cheese.  She has been doing this for 40 years.  Her work consists of buying the cheese in an area that produces it, which is four hours from the city.  She buys the cheese and takes it to the city to sell for a higher price.  She also has specific buyers to whom she takes cheese three times a week.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  During all of this time she was able to take advantage of the opportunities for growth that were presented to her.  This is because she had the needed capital thanks to these loans.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

Felipa will use the loan to buy 100 cheeses in order to stock the customers that she has in different cities.

loans.use: to buy 100 cheeses in order to stock the customers that she has in different cities.

loans.name: Medoune

texts.fr: Monsieur Medoune  est un homme marié qui vit au SÉNÉGAL. Il est mécanicien et évolue dans le secteur du commerce de pièces détachées depuis plus de 10ans. Il est membre d’un guichet d’U-IMCEC et sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 500000 FCFA. Ce financement lui permettra d’acquérir des pièces détachées pour le renforcement du stock de son magasin.
texts.en: Mr. Medoune is a married man who lives in Senegal. He is a mechanic and has been working in the commercial sector of replacement parts for over ten years. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan for the amount of 500,000 francs CFA. This financing will enable him to acquire spare parts for bolstering his store stock.

loans.use: to acquire replacement parts to resell

loans.name: José Feliciano

texts.es: José Feliciano con veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene diez años de experiencia en el rubro y eso le ha traído grandes beneficios, porque mejora su trabajo día con día y obtiene cosechas de calidad, el terreno de cultivo es apto para la siembra y esta ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y por los precios bajos además del buen servicio; José es un hombre entregado a su labor, motivado, siempre buscando las mejores alternativas que le den paso a un futuro mas prospero, confía en que si no deja de luchar alcanzara grandes metas. En esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción y no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, abono, herramientas, etc. José Feliciano tiene buen record crediticio, por lo que asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y al mismo tiempo le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
José Feliciano, 28 years old, lives together with his life partner and his child.  He makes a living in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of corn and sorghum.  He has 10 years of experience in the field and that has brought him great benefits, because he improves his work day by day and obtains quality harvests.  The plot of land is suitable for planting and is located in an area of agricultural impact.  He does business in all of the surrounding areas of the community and already has many customers since the people prefer him for the quality of the product and for the low prices as well as the good service.  José is a man devoted to his work, motivated, always looking for better alternatives that will lead toward a more prosperous future for him.  He trusts that if he doesn’t stop struggling he will achieve great goals. 

In this planting season he wants to increase production and doesn’t possess the sufficient capital.  For this reason he is applying to Integral for a loan that will permit him to buy corn and sorghum seeds, manure, tools, etc.  José Feliciano has a good credit record, therefore assuring that he will be able to settle the debt and at the same time he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seeds, manure and tools.

loans.name: Mahodo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHODO est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Tété Denise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tété Denise est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Tété Denise est mariée à un certain Boniface. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges du ménage, Tété Denise vend depuis dix ans de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagné de sauce) et des sables lagunaires de façon secondaire dans un marché du Bénin. Tété Denise s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Tété Denise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHODO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHODO is composed of three persons who live in the same district and who belong to the same tontine. The group's representative, Tété Denise, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Boniface. The couple have six children, all in school and in their care. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. 

To make sure the diverse household expenses are covered, Tété Denise has been selling food (corn polenta served with sauce) for ten years. Secondarily, she sells lagoon sand at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Tété Denise is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHODO, a fifth loan from ALIDé. The loans received previously were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, and lagoon sand

loans.name: Edwin Giovanni

texts.es: Edwin Giovanni de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura, desde joven aprendió el oficio y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa que le permite desempeñarse al cien porciento en su labor, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y esta cercano a donde vive, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y tiene clientela fija pues las personas lo prefieren por la excelente calidad y los precios bajos además él se caracteriza por su amabilidad en el servicio; Edwin es un hombre dedicado a su labor, entusiasta con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino a un futuro prospero para el y su familia, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Edwin Giovanni tiene buenas referencias de pago por eso asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin Giovanni is 30 years old and lives with his life’s companion and their children. He cultivates maize and corn and has been working as a farmer for several years. He learned the job as a young man and has earned valuable experience which enables him to carry out his work at the 100 per cent level. The land he cultivates is located in a good farming area and is near where he lives. He markets in all the surrounding areas and has fixed customers since people prefer him for the excellent quality and low prices of his crops. He is also known for his helpful service.

Edwin is a man who is dedicated to his work and who is enthusiastic and eager to get ahead. He is always looking for new opportunities that will lead to a prosperous future for him and his family. 

During this planting season he wants to increase his production. Consequently he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will enable him to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, herbicide, insecticide, tools, etc. Edwin Giovanni has a good payment history, thus he is sure he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, herbicide, insecticide, tools.

loans.name: Missimahu 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMAHU 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans un même village. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La  représentante du groupe, du nom de Rebecca est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rebecca est âgée de 52 ans. Rebecca est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Pierre. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Rebecca assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges du ménage. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Rebecca vend du riz et des boissons depuis une trentaine d'année à son domicile. Rebecca s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Rebecca sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMAHU 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MISSIMAHU 1 is composed of three persons who are friends living in the same village. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Rebecca, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 52 years old and married to a furniture maker named Pierre. The couple have six children, all in school, of whom four remain in their care. Along with her husband, Rebecca ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To support herself and her children, Rebecca has been selling rice and beverages for about thirty years out of her home. She gets her supplies  from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Rebecca is requesting, along with the other members of the group MISSIMAHU 1, a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy beverages and sacks of rice

loans.name: Missimahu 2 Group

texts.fr: MISSIMAHU 2 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe d’artisans. Le représentant du groupe du nom de Jérémie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 37 ans. Jérémie est marié à une marchande du nom de Nathalie. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, trois sont leurs propres enfants. Jérémie vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Jérémie assure ensemble avec sa femme les charges de la maison. Jérémie n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la soudure, activité qu'il mène depuis une dizaine d'année dans une ville du Bénin. Cette activité permet à Jérémie de faire face à ses différents besoins et de nourrir sa famille. Jérémie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Jérémie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMAHU 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
MISSIMAHU 2 is a group composed of three persons who belong to the same artisans association. The group's representative, Jérémie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and married to a merchant named Nathalie. The couple have four children, some in school but all in their care. Among the children, three are their own. Jérémie lives together with his wife and children. Along with her, he ensures that the household expenses are covered.

Jérémie did not attend school, but he learned how to weld. It is work that he has been doing for about ten years in a city in Benin. This business enables him to cope with his various needs and to feed his family. He gets his supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of his burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Jérémie is requesting, along with the other members of the group MISSIMAHU 2, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies and materials (welding machine, grinding wheels, etc.)

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana tiene 24 años, vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos, en la casa que compró su madre hace 8 años.
Ella, desde hace 2 años, vende cosméticos por catalogo en la universidad donde estudia, sus principales clientes son sus compañero de estudio y amistades que vienen a su casa. Ofrece sus productos al crédito para después cobrarles por partes. Ha notado que tiene ventajas esta actividad porque le permite estudiar, es por eso que se ha propuesto incrementar sus ventas. Ya le falta muy poco para graduarse como ingeniera en Industrias alimentarias, se siente muy agradecida con su negocio, pues le permitió pagar sus estudios. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Mujeres unidas” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Se siente satisfecha de su labor, pues gracias a estos préstamos puede incrementar su mercadería.
Esta vez, Johana invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza para los clientes que ya le hicieron pedidos de perfumes, cremas y joyas.
texts.en:
Johana is 24 years old and lives with her parents and two brothers in the house that her mother bought eight years ago.

For the past two years Johana has been selling cosmetics by catalog at the university where she is studying. Her principal customers are her fellow students and friends who come to her house. She offers her products on credit and then collects in installments. She has noted that this job has advantages because it enables her to study. Consequently she has proposed increasing her sales. She is now very close to graduating as an engineer in the food industry and is very grateful to have her business since it allowed her to pay for her studies.

She belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” Communal Bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP. She is satisfied with its work since thanks to these loans she can expand her merchandise. This time Johana will invest in the purchase of more beauty products for her customers since they have already placed orders for perfume, creams and jewelry.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her customers since they have already placed orders for perfume, creams and jewelry.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Cris works hard to support her family.

She has a kitchenware retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Mary Cris is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more kitchenware to sell.

Mary Cris has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines.

Merlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for three years.

Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 43 years old and married. She has two children with one in school. Remegia works very hard to provide for them.

Remegia runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell.

Remegia has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, snack foods and other grocery items. 

In the future, Remegia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 37 years old and married. She has two children.

Rita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Rita has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising livestock.

Rita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith works hard to support one child. She is married and raises livestock in the Philippines.

Bernadith requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Bernadith is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Marilyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support six children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Cecilia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
This is Ursula, She previously accessed an 29,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ursula hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and married with five children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Janet has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Janet aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 30 years old and married. She has two children.

Aiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional coconut wine to sell.

Aiza has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the coconut wine vending business for seven years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Aiza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 59 years old and married with 3 children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail business selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa business for 13 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Marilyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Nena has been in this business for 2 years. Nena earns more income from farming rice. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es:
Sulema es una mujer muy amable, vive en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposo Cristian y su pequeña hija Andrea.
Hace dos años su suegra les heredó algunos terrenos agrícolas donde ahora siembran papa. “Desearía sembrar hortalizas y otros tubérculos, pero no tengo más terrenos”, comenta. Le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo, pues desde niña aprendió todo lo necesario en este oficio. En cada cosecha vende su producción en el mercado mayorista de la zona y ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos y aprovechar esta temporada, que es de siembra grande.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo pudo aprovechar las oportunidades de desarrollo que se le presentaron, pues tenía el capital necesario gracias a estos préstamos. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que todos los integrantes de su grupo son muy responsables.
Sulema invertirá este dinero en el pago del tractor que volteará la tierra donde piensa sembrar. Cada hora de trabajo cuesta 80 soles.
texts.en:
Sulema is a very amiable woman.  She lives with her husband, Cristian, and her little daughter, Andrea, in her mother’s house.

Two years ago her mother-in-law gave them some farmland where they now grow potatoes.  “I would like to grow vegetables and other tubers, but I do not have more land,” she comments.  She really likes working in the field.  When she was a girl she learned everything she needed to know for this trade.  At every harvest she sells her production at the wholesale market in the area.

She now wishes to improve her income and to take advantage of this big planting season.

This is her third loan with MFP.  In all of this time she was able to take advantage of the growth opportunities presented to her because she had the necessary capital thanks to these loans.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments because all of the members of her group are very responsible.  

Sulema will use the loan to pay for the tractor to turn over the land where she plans to plant.  Each hour of work costs 80 soles.

loans.use: to pay 80 soles per hour for the tractor to turn over the land where she plans to plant.

loans.name: José Benjamín

texts.es: José Benjamín de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y cítricos tomate, papa, mandarina, entre otros tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y hoy en día es como se gana la vida, el terreno de su cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene clientela muy valiosa, que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precio accesible, además el servicio es inigualable siempre esta a la orden de los clientes; José Benjamín es un hombre admirable, trabajador con muchas metas por cumplir siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abra camino al éxito, quiere aumentar su producción en esta temporada de cosecha pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, insecticida, herbicida, herramientas, etc. José Benjamín tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejore calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Benjamín, 46, lives with his partner and their children. He makes a living planting vegetables and citrics such as tomato, potato and mandarin orange, among others. He has been planting for many years and has gained extensive experience, which allows him to get the best harvests always. He learned this craft at a very young age and this is how he earns a living today. His land plot is located in a highly agricultural zone, very close to his home. Everything he produces, he sells around the community and he has a precious customer base that prefers him because he always has what they need at an affordable price. Also, his service is not equaled by anyone's and he is always ready to take care of his customers. José Benjamín is an admirable, hard-working man with many goals ahead. He is always keeping an eye on new opportunities that might pave his way to success. He wants to increase his production this harvesting season but he needs some capital for it, therefore he is asking a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase seeds, manure, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc. José Benjamín has good credit references and he assures he will be able to pay his debt and offer his family a better quality of life at the same time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, insecticide, herbicide and tools

loans.name: Den-Den

texts.en:
This is Den-Den. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used for purchasing necessary equipment and materials for the barber shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy new equipment and materials needed for her barber shop. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Den-Den hopes that her business will continue to be successful. It is also her desire to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new equipment and materials needed for her barber shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy sacks of dry maize, beans and wheat for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her grandchildren. Her hopes and dreams are to build a store for storing her cereals and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy dry maize, beans and wheat for sale in her business.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Batbaatar, 24, sells clothes with his wife. They have been operating their business for last 3 years and own 3 stalls.  Batbaatar is a very hardworking and fair young man, as his coworkers identified him. Currently he lives with his wife and his parents in the ger district, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In summer and autumn, he has big sales of clothes for women, men and kids. Lately, his stock has been decreased and he wanted to increase it before this autumn. It is a very good chance to enlarge his sales volume and earn extra profits. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to buy casual clothes to increase his working capital.  In addition, he has a plan to have a baby in the next year.

loans.use: To buy casual clothes to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Ma. Soledad

texts.en:
Ma. Soledad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a scrap business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Ma. Soledad has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling dried coconut meat.

Ma. Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is 40 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a successful business woman. Her lifetime partner is a director of lyceum of their region, and they have 4 children. They live in the house she has succeeded in building thanks to her husband's great dedication.

Fotima is one of the smart businesswomen of her region. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop business and in this way improve their living condition. Her elder daughter helps her with the business. She wants to develop business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is the 6th loan she is requesting from MLO IMON and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy children’s clothes as school uniform for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes as school uniforms

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is an enterprising woman who earns a living through selling cashew nuts at the market. Her husband sells coconuts and together they make sure that their three children have all the basic needs including education. Thanks to their efforts, all three children are in school.

Mwanakombo has been in business for two years and she aims to open a depot so as to increase her clientele and sales. She lives in her own house that is thatched, with mud walls. However, she does not die hard and she has the faith and determination that she will one day own a permanent house that has all the facilities.

Mwanakombo has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 37, is a seamstress in a private tailoring company in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been doing her work for three years. His husband, Tsedenbal, 37, operates a car wash, but he has not enough numbers of clients usually.  Because of that, he runs a taxi around the city in the nights to earn extra income. Altantsetseg lives with her husband and her 2 daughters in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt. Altantsetseg is requesting a loan to buy a car which runs on natural-gas. She and her husband both know that using natural gas is healthful and important to the people’s health and environment. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of the car that uses natural gas.

loans.use: To buy a car which runs on natural-gas.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
To earn a living, Saumu works extra hard to cater to the needs of her family.  She and her husband have three children, ages eight, six and eight months. She lives in the coastal region of Kenya. Saumu sells coconuts as wholesale to a neighboring coconut oil manufacturing firm. Her goal is to see that her children become professionals, since they are the source of joy for their marriage.

Demand for supplying more coconuts has increased but she is financially challenged, so she is requesting a loan so as to expand her supplies by buying more stock of coconuts for sale. This will allow her to maintain her customers even as she provides them with good services.

loans.use: buying more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.es: Rosa Evelia de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite mejorar su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de incidencia agrícola muy cercano a su residencia, comercia en los lugres aledaños a la localidad y tiene mucha clientela fija, pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Rosa es una mujer admirable, enérgica, y con muchos sueños que desea alcanzar, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le abran puertas al éxito, el ultimo año de siembra tuvo muchas perdidas debido al clima, quiere recuperarse pero no posee suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Rosa Evelia tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura poder saldar la deuda, al mismo tiempo que confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Rosa Evelia, 42, lives with her children. She makes a living by farming, particularly corn. She has been working on this field for many years and has gained precious experience that allows her to improve her technique and get the best harvests. Her land plot is located in a highly agricultural zone, very close to her home too. She sells her produce nearby her community and has a lot of regular customers. People prefer her because she always has what they need: high-quality products at an affordable price, besides an unparalleled service. Rosa is an admirable woman, full of energy and dreams she wishes to fulfill. She is always looking for opportunities that can pave her way to success. In the previous planting season she had many losses because of the weather. She wants to recover but doesn't have enough capital and that is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to purchase bean and corn seeds, herbicides, manure, tools, etc. Rosa Evelia has good credit references and she assures she will be able to pay her debt while offering her family economic security.

loans.use: purchase bean and corn seeds, herbicides, manure, tools

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor vive en la ciudad de Milagros en una pequeña finca propiedad de sus padres, el negocio al que se dedica proviene desde hace varios años ya que es un negocio familiar. Hace poco formo su familia por lo que se dedica con más esfuerzo a su trabajo. El se dedica a la venta de leña y carbón ya que su finca tiene gran cantidad de arboles los cuales han sido plantados por varias de sus generaciones. En la atención le ayuda su esposa ya que a veces él se encuentra cortando la leña, lo cual es un proceso muy largo y pesado, esto es porque Víctor no tiene maquinaria. Trabaja todo el día esto no se le complica porque está acostumbrado al trabajo pesado, su mayor problema es la falta de transporte el cual necesita para entregar la leña y el carbón cuando tiene los pedidos. Hace varios meses se dio cuenta que el lugar donde hace el carbón es pequeño por eso se le agota rápidamente, con el crédito que solicita va adecuar el lugar, también invertirá en arboles para la leña. Su sueño a futuro es poderle ayudar a su esposa a reunir un capital para que pueda empezar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the town of Milagros on a small farm belonging to his parents. He has run the family business for several years. He has a family of his own now so works even harder. Victor sells firewood and charcoal as the farm has a lot of trees planted by many generations of the family.

His wife helps him with the business as he is sometimes busy cutting the wood, a long and strenuous job because he doesn't own any machinery. Victor works every day; this doesn't bother him as he is accustomed to hard work. His biggest problem is the lack of transportation to deliver the wood and charcoal when his customers have given him orders.

A few months ago he realized that the place where he makes the charcoal was small and he was rapidly running out of wood. With the loan he plans to renovate the place and also buy some more trees to make firewood.

His dream is to help his wife to save enough money so that she can start her own business.

loans.use: With his firewood and charcoal business

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 48 years old and married with 6 children. With 4 children in school, Flordelisa works very hard to provide for them.

Flordelisa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Flordelisa has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, milk, etc. 

In the future, Flordelisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joylen

texts.en:
Joylen is 44 years old and married with one child.

Joylen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a engine lubricant retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Joylen has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the engine lubricant retail for 10 years and also earns an income from selling gasoline.

Joylen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 61 years old and married. 

Ludy buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Ludy has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Ludy has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Ludy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with three children between the ages of seven years and seven months. She is married to Hamadi, a businessman. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Bahati is a woman of high integrity who always tries whenever opportunities arise. She likes to see herself move forward in life. For the last three years, she has been engaged in the selling of petroleum at the market, a business she is still doing up to this date, her primary customers being motorcycle-taxi operators. She says that her customers like her due to her good services and the fair price of her petrol. Bahati is a visionary woman who dreams of owning a petrol station in the future. The urge to expand her business makes her ask for a loan in the amount of KES 50,000 to purchase gallons of petrol for sale. The previous loan helped her to increase her sales and her income in general.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of petrol for sale.

loans.name: Aye Ofe Wahala Group

texts.fr: AYE OFE WAHALA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine et sont liés par un lien de parenté. La représentante du groupe, Mignondo (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée 52 ans. Mignondo est mariée à un certain Ayadji. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois à leur charge. Mignondo vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Mignondo vend des tissus et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Mignondo s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mignondo s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe AYE OFE WAHALA pour consentir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AYE OFE WAHALA is a group of three persons whose members belong to the same tontine and who are bound by family relationships. The group's representative, Mignondo (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 52 years old and married to a man named Ayadji. The couple have five children, all educated, of whom three are in their care. Mignondo lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. 

To support herself, Mignondo sells cloth and jewelry via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Mignondo joined with the other members of the group AYE OFE WAHALA to agree to a third loan with ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy cloth and jewelry to resell

loans.name: Bitossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BITOSSESSI est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Florence est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Florence est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Florence est mariée à un maçon du nom de Gildas. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Florence n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce à son domicile depuis douze ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Florence vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux. Florence s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Florence sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BITOSSESSI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group BITOSSESSI is composed of four persons who are friends living in the same village. The group's representative, Florence, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a mason named Gildas. The couple have six children, some in school but all in their care. Florence lives together with her husband and children and, along with her husband, ensures that the household expenses are covered. 

Florence did not attend school but learned how to style hair. She has been doing this work in her home for twelve years. Parallel to this business, she sells hair extensions and hair products. She gets her supplies from her region. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Florence is requesting, along with the other members of the group BITOSSESSI, a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair products

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Christy runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Christy has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Christy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and widowed with 4 children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and married with 1 child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Eva has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, milk, soft drink, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely works hard to support her family. Fely is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Fely has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Fely has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Fely would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, 25, is a resident of Mwambalazi, a small village on the south coast of Kenya. She is a woman who dreams of progressing in life. After being a farmer for some time and running a retail shop, she decided to start another business so as to increase her monthly income. In 2010, she decided to start a coconut-selling business, selling to the neighboring countryside since there was demand. She stocks the coconuts in her shop.

Riziki is working hard to ensure that she provides for her children and also can help her husband, who is a businessman, with the household expenses. She says that her major challenge is transportation cost and that she dreams of expanding her business and opening new businesses in the future. Riziki has insufficient capital to increase her inventory, so she is asking for help from Yehu to add stock of coconuts for sale. This will enable her to increase her profits and provide a quality life for her family.

loans.use: to add stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: El Sr. Román de 52 años de edad es casado y no tiene dependientes económicos. El trabaja como guardia de seguridad mientras que su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica en casa particulares. Román siempre se ha propuesto brindarle lo mejor a su esposa es por esto que en esta ocasión solicita de nuestra ayuda para la compra de cemento para en un futuro poder realizar trabajos de construcción en su casa, más específicamente una dala  esto quiere decir que hará una zanja y  la rellenara con cemento ya que en las temporadas de lluvia el agua siempre entra a su casa. El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: 52-year old Román is married but doesn't have any financial dependents. He works as a security guard; his wife is a servant in a private house. Román has always tried to give his wife the best he can so he is now seeking a loan to buy cement so that in the future he can do some construction work on the house. He wishes to install a pipe in a trench lined with cement so that in the rainy season the water doesn't come into the house. He is grateful for the help that is being offered.

loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen earns her living by running a general store. Her earnings help to fund the education of her child and support her household and business expenditures. She previously received a loan in the amount of PhP 24,000, which she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of the grocery items and products needed in her business. 

She would like to apply for another PhP 25,000 loan so that she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She believes that the more items she can display at the store, the better. Offering a larger selection will bring her a better profit. The increased profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Helen hopes to be able to expand her business soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ángel Santiago
