texts.en: Mr. Chuluuntogtokh, 25 has been running a taxi since 2010. He lives with his wife and his son in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a vendor in the bazaar and earns not enough. Since last year, he has been building a small wooden house for his family. Building is at 80% of processing and he wanted to buy some insulation materials to the walls. In winter, most of the Mongolian households use the coal fired stoves to stay warm at home /using the wood or other chemical fuels are unaccepted in Mongolia due to the harmful and less forest source/. Making the wall insulation is one of the good ways to reduce the usage of the coal fuel in Mongolia. As we know that the coal usage influences worst to the air pollution and health of people. So that he decided to buy the some building materials such as the foam, cement to the wall insulation. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to make the wall insulation to his building family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his rundown house.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, aged 34, is a street vender. She sells pure drinking water, soft drinks, and snack foods at the riverside in front of the royal palace where she is visited by local people and tourists every day. She typically earns approximately 12,000 KHR per day to add to her husband’s main income. Chan has been in this type of business for two years. Chan is married to a humble man who provides a tuk-tuk transportation service around Phnom Penh city. Together, they have given birth to two children who are currently single.

Chan would like to get a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase merchandise to sell such as soft drinks, pure drinking water, and snack foods. She hopes that she will be able to make her business more profitable and yield a better income. Chan is confident that she can pay her loan back to our lenders on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell such as soft drinks, pure drinking water, and snack foods

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, 31, is a garment worker who lives in a suburb of Phom Penh. Her husband, Peng, is 30 years old and has a business buying and selling recycling materials. The couple have been married since 2010 and have no children yet.

Vannak is asking for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to provide her husband with capital to buy additional recycling materials to sell.

loans.use: To provide her husband with capital to buy additional recycling materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en: Lauriana works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Lauriana requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving. Lauriana has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lauriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Marietes

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Marietes works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from her chicken-vending and fermented duck egg (balut)-selling business. Marietes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Marietes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 72 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of  22,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stocks for her general store.

Adelaida has already taken out and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and a boarding house.

Adelaida aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea (pictured here) is 52 years old and her husband, Yorng, is 61 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978 and have five children - three sons and two daughters. Two of the children are married and live separately, one is a garment worker, another one operates a business installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players, and the other stays at home. 

Chea sells groceries at home, while her husband is an electrician. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items. This will help Chea to better respond to her customers' needs.

loans.use: to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.name: Deodima

texts.en:
Deodima is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more items like pants, bags, blouses, and other pieces of clothing.

NWTF is relisting Deodima's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items like pants, bags, blouses, and other pieces of clothing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 66 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoos, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Adelaida has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoos, eggs, spices, etc. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcyle.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years and she also earns extra income from raising livestock. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is a 33-year-old lady. She is married to a 43-year-old man named Alex. From their marriage, Debbie and Alex are blessed with 3 children: Franko, 14, who is studying at a junior high school; Lita, 7, who is studying at an elementary school; and Viona, 5, who is attending kindergarten.

Debbie operates a kiosk business. The income from the business enables her to provide for the needs of her family. Daily, basic needs such as instant noodles, snacks, sugar, bath soaps, detergents, candy, frying oil, wheat flour, etc. are available at her kiosk. Debbie is thinking of improving her kiosk business by completing her inventory with more items as demanded by her customers. She requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on cigarettes, beverages, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent, instant noodles, and petrol to be sold in front of her kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes, beverages, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent, instant noodles, and petrol to be sold in front of her kiosk

loans.name: Fuente De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Yanet esta casad, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio con sus padres ya que sus padres tenían crianza de gallinas y luego las vendían, ella lleva ahats ael mom3ento 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo  que lo utilizara para la compra de pollos y gallinas parea crianza, ya que quiere tener una granja grande, y así mejorar su ganancias cuando corresponda venderlos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio. Una de las integrantes de la foto no califico para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Nancy Yanet is married, twenty years old, and [has] six years of primary education.  She devotes her [energies] to domestic duties and raising animals.  She started this business with her parents since they had [experience] breeding hens and later selling them.  At this moment, Nancy has five years of experience [in this line of work].

She [has] organized a group for the [purpose of] requesting a loan.  [Her portion of the loan] will be used for the purchase of chickens and hens to raise since she has the desire to have a large farm.  Likewise, [the additional animals] will increase her profits when it comes time to sell them.  The other members of the group work in the craft trade and [general] commerce. 

Note: One of the members in the picture, did not qualify for [this particular] loan.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and hens to raise.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children - 1 of the children is currently in school. For the past 1 year, Amos has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, dry beans, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like rice, soap, and dry beans for resale, and will help Amos to generate greater profits and pay his children's medical bills. Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to build a good house for himself. 

Amos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like rice, soap, and dry beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more kiosk stock i.e., sugar, coffee, snacks, bread, and also several new items i.e., eggs, betel vine, and palm sugar.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Loice has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Loice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Loice to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Loice hopes that in the future she will be able to see her children go to university. 

Loice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Angelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, aged 30, is a farmer who happily lives with her spouse and three children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. All of her children are in local schools and need her daily allowances. Sim would like to yield more income from her farming business so that she can save it for the future education of her children. She plans to place them in a good college in Phnom Penh.

Due to financial constraints, Sim has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to install in the farming process and to ensure a fruitful harvest in this coming season. She hopes that it will help improve her income, which she can use to satisfy her household needs and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Fransiska

texts.en:
Fransiska is a 27-year-old lady. She is single and is living with her parents. Fransiska has 2 siblings but they are married and live with their families. 

Fransiska has a kiosk business selling various daily needs, i.e., instant noodles, coffee, margarine, sandals, soy sauce, cooking oil, some snacks, etc. She has been engaged in this business for 3 years. She is grateful for running the business as it enables her to meet her family's daily needs. 

Fransiska would like to improve the income generated by initiating a computer rental business. She would like to buy three computers and printers to be rented. She received information about TLM and was interested in joining their individual lending program. She then submitted the loan application and requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to implement her plan.

loans.use: to buy three computers and printers to be rented.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es:
Ynes tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y con 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus 3 hijos en el Dist de Tambogrande al norte del Peru. Ellos viven en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla la ella es la venta de cerveza y piqueos (tapas) en su propio domicilio, en el cual atiende preferencialmente los días sábados, domingos y lunes. Cuenta con clienta ya establecida en la zona y tiene más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio. Su conviviente es agricultor con chacra propia en donde siembra maíz y frijol. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola. Entre los dos buscan darle unas buenas condidiones de vida a sus hijos, y es por eso que trabajan juntos. Ynes es parte esensial de la familia. Precisamente ella busca un prestamo para consolidar su negocio. En particular, el destino del crédito será para la compra de cerveza por cantidad y así obtener mayor margen de ganancia. Esta estrategia le ayudara  co su negocio.
texts.en:
Ynes is 30 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children in her care. She lives in her own house with her partner and their three children in the district of Tambogrande in the north of Peru. They live in the rural part of the district, but they have electrical service.

The business that she is developing is the sale of beer and snacks (tapas) in her own home, where she serves preferentially on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays. She already has regular customers in the zone and she has more than 3 years of experience in her business. Her partner is a farmer with his own farm where he plants corn and beans. In addition, he works as an agricultural laborer. Between the two of them, they seek to give good living conditions to their children, and this is why they work together. Ynes is an essential part of the family.  She is seeking a loan precisely to strengthen her business. In particular, the  destiny of the loan will be to purchase beer in quantity and thus obtain a better profit margin. This strategy will help her in her business.

loans.use: to purchase beer in quantity and thus obtain a better profit margin

loans.name: Mukhfuza

texts.en:
Mukhfuza is 45 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Mamajan is her partner. They have 1 child and they love him very much. They live together in a big house.

She sells a variety of fabrics for women's dresses. She stores her merchandise in a local market in her town. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over 5 years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise.  As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business by selling new seasonable cloth. She is asking for a loan of 4000 TJS to buy fabrics for the new season.

This is her fourth loan with Imon International organization, and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 70 kg of fertilizers and pay the cost of labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en: Jubelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Jubelyn requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for 3 years now and also earns additional income from raising hogs. In the future, Jubelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Inatullo

texts.ru: Инатулло родился 1984 году в районе Хамадони. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Инатулло живет вместе с родителями. Его отец работает учителем. Жена Инатулло домохозяйка. Сам Инатулло уже год как занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке района, где занимается торговлей обуви. Инатулло просит кредит для приобретения детской и подростковой осеней обуви.
texts.en: Inatullo was born in 1984 in Hamadoni. He is married and has one child. Inatullo and his family live with his parents. His father works as a teacher. Inatullo's wife is a home maker and Inatullow himself works in retail. He rents a market stall at the central market where he sells shoes. Inatullo is requesting this loan to purchase a batch of fall season shoes for children and teenagers.

loans.use: to purchase fall season shoes for children and adolescents

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 21 years old and a single man from Naivasha. He has a quarry business that he has been doing for the past three years. 

David has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy new blocks of quarry ground.

He hopes to grow his business and open a spare parts shop in Mai Mahiu in the near future.

loans.use: To buy new blocks

loans.name: Alie

texts.ru:
В сельском хозяйстве Алие  начинала свою работу агрономом. С 2003г., уже как женщина фермер, она на паевых участках выращивает виноград и землянику. 
После смерти мужа ей помогают 23-х летний сын, который учится в Национальной академии природно-охранного и курортного строительства и 22-х летняя дочь, которая учится в Таврическом национальном университете.
Обрабатывать участок в размере 0.11 га семье очень сложно, поэтому Алие  нанимает работников. 
Для обработки земли было принято решение приобрести мотоблок, который ускорит вспашку земли и понизит количество сорняков.
Алие очень благодарит за ту  помощь, которую оказывает АКМ. АКМ вернуло ей смысл к жизни после смерти мужа и придало стремление к развитию ее фермерского хозяйства.  В дальнейшем она планирует приобрести бензиновый опрыскиватель для растений. 
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования бензинового опрыскивателя.
texts.en:
Alie started her agricultural work as a plan specialist at the kolhoz. In 2003 she became an independent female farmer and has been growing grapes and strawberries on her allocated plot of land. After Alie's husband passed away her children continued to help her with the farm. Alie has a 23 year old son who is a student at the National Academy of environmental preservation and tourism and a 22 year old daughter who is studying at the Tavric National university. However, to take care of everything on her 0.11 hectare/0.3 acre plot of land is a big job and Alie also hires a farmhand to help her. To improve soil condition Alie decided to purchase a motorized tiller which will help her til the soil faster and reduce the number of weeds. 

Alie is very grateful for the help that AKM is offering. AKM returned to her the meaning of life after her husband passed away and gave her the dedication to succeed in her farming business. In the future Alie plans to purchase a motorized sprayer for her plants. She needs to take out this loan to purchase this piece of equipment.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Saidbahrom

texts.ru: Саидбахром трудолюбивый, женатый человек и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Он живет отдельно от родителей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 2 года назад, Саидбахром начал свой бизнес. Он продает телефоны, диски и аксессуары в магазине, который находится в центре его города. Его жена преподает в университете и имеет маленькую зарплату. Саидбахром запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки товара, чтобы пополнить оборотный капитал. Он ждет вашу доброту
texts.en: Saidbahrom is a hard working family man who is raising one son. He and his family live separately from his parents. His wife teaches at the university and earns a very small salary. Two years ago Saidbahrom opened a business in order to provide for his family. He sells mobile phones, CDs and accessories in his centrally located media store in Khujand. He is requesting a loan of 3000 US dollars to purchase goods for his store and have more capital for big store purchases. Saidbahrom is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones, CDs and other goods to expand inventory

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her tailoring business. 

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials that will make clothes for resale, and will help Dorothy to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Dorothy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a training center. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorothy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase materials that will make clothes for resale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle transportation business.

Dolores has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from clothing sales.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle transportation.

loans.name: Dinisa

texts.en:
Dinisa is 28 years old and married with two children.

Dinisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Dinisa has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending and e-loading.

Dinisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Candido runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Candido has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Candido would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Crispy is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Crispy has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothes to sell for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years. Elizabeth also earns income from peanut sales.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zulfikor

texts.en: Zulfikor is 17 years old. He is a future specialist in applied mathematics and is enrolled at the Slavic University as a student of first course. He is excelling in school with good marks. His favorite subjects are math, computers and English. He was one of the best pupils in his school and took part successfully in all competitions. He has a lot of friends and many of them are his classmates. Zulfikor lives with his parents who are workers and earn small incomes, not enough to support Zulfikor’s studies at the university. He is asking for a loan of 840 USD to study at the university and realize his dream. A smart boy who wants to continue his education awaits your support. Please help him if possible.

loans.use: to pay for his studies at the university.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 50 years old and married with two children. Melva works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Melva has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other grocery items. 

In the future Melva would like to save enough money to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Julia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Julia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Julia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from buying and selling scrap and piglets.

Elsie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more sac charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To augment her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 65 kg of fertilizer and pay for manual labour for his rice farm.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer, and she has two children ages ten and fourteen. She sells basic household goods like spices, rice, noodles, eggs, canned goods, fish and soft drinks.
 
Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy noodles, rice, soft drinks and more fresh fish to resell. She needs to make further investments in her store, but she lacks the funds to do so. 

With the loan, Carmelita will be able to augment her stocks to attract more customers, giving her the chance to increase her sales. She hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, soft drinks and more fresh fish.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 32 years old, married to Celestine, and blessed with three children aged eight, six, and four years old. 

Amos sells firewood, a business he started 8 years ago. Amos earns a monthly income of KES 16,000. He wants to purchase more firewood for sale and has requested a first loan of KES 30,000. 

The profit he makes will help support his family’s needs. He dreams of a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur ABDOU, un ouvrier célibataire qui vit au SÉNÉGAL, évolue depuis plus de 10ans dans la maçonnerie.  Membre d’un guichet  de l’U-IMCEC ou il a déjà eu à rembourser un prêt antérieur, il sollicite un crédit de 300000FCFA. Le financement pourra constituer pour lui un moyen d’acquérir des mobiliers (lit et armoire). Son objectif consiste à améliorer le  cadre de vie de son lieu d’habitation.
texts.en: Mr. Abdou, an unmarried worker who lives in Senegal, has spent more than 10 years working as a mason. As a member of the local branch of U-IMCEC, where he has already repaid one previous loan, he is now seeking a loan of 300000 FCFA. This loan will provide him with the means to acquire some furniture (a bed and a closet). His goal is to improve his living conditions at home.

loans.use: To obtain a bed and a closet for personal use.

loans.name: Yordan

texts.en:
Yordan is a 47-year-old weaver. She is married to Hanokh, who is 52 years old. They have 5 children: 1) Yerry, 28 years old and married; 2) Wati, 23 years old and married; 3) Nandis, 18 years old and studying at Junior High School, Grade 3; 4)	Asni, 16 years old and studying at Junior High School, Grade 2; 5) Rolinda, 7 years old and studying at Elementary School, Grade 2.

Yordan has been running a weaving business for 15 years. She is well trained in creating different kinds of traditional sarongs and shawls with different patterns. She is grateful for having the skill from her mother as it enables her to earn extra income for her family. However, Yordan recognized that the income generated from the weaving business is unstable. Therefore, she would like to try a new business selling crops. She plans to buy cassava, cassava leaves, squash, pumpkin, betel vine, tamarind, etc. to resell at the market. To do so, Yordan is requesting loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy cassava, cassava leaves, squash, pumpkin, betel vine, tamarind, etc. to resell at the market.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Edith est une femme de 34 ans, célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 06 ans qui va déjà à l'école.Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 04 ans où elle vend du poisson à la braise.Son activité est florissante à cause de son savoir faire dans la matière et de son expérience qui lui ont permis au fil du temps d'agrandir et de fidéliser sa clientèle.Mais la petitesse de son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner en gros ce qui crée de constantes ruptures de stock et une baisse de plus en plus considérable de sa clientèle.Pour éviter une perte définitive de sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en gros en poissons ce qui lui permettra d'éviter les ruptures , mais également de retenir ses clients et de gagner d'autres. Les bénéfices que génèreront cet investissement lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en multipliant les points de vente mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Edith is a 34-year-old unmarried mother of one child, who is six years old and already attends school. Edith has been a merchant in a district of the capital for four years, and she sells braised fish. Her business is flourishing thanks to her know-how in the field and her experience, which have allowed her to expand her activity over time and generate a loyal customer base. But the small amount of capital she has does not allow her to obtain supplies in bulk, which then leads to constant stock shortages and an increasing drop-off in her clientele. To avoid a permanent loss of customers, she is seeking this loan in order to obtain supplies of fish in bulk, which will allow her to avoid shortages as well as retain her customers and gain new ones. The profits this investment will generate will allow her to expand her business by increasing her points of sale and also to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy boxes of fish.

loans.name: Yuheni

texts.en:
Yuheni is a 34-year-old widow. She has been blessed with 4 children. They are Yemima (12), Yabes (10), Yusak (8) and Cuanwi (3). The older 3 attend school. Yuheni is an entrepreneur. She sells cakes and sweet ice around her residence and at a nearby school. She makes donuts, "onde-onde" (traditional cakes made of rasped cassava and palm sugar), fried bananas, etc. 

As a single parent, Yuheni keeps working hard to be able to cover her family's needs by producing cakes and ice regularly. Actually, she really wants to increase the number of cakes and ice that she sells, but she doesn't have enough capital to do so. Yuheni was introduced to TLM's lending program by a loan officer. Yuheni became interested in the program offered and requested a loan amounting to 5,000,000 IDR from TLM in order to purchase basic ingredients, e.g., sugar and wheat flour in bulk, cassava, bananas and several containers in which to put the cakes.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients, e.g., sugar and wheat flour in bulk, cassava, bananas and several containers in which to put the cakes.

loans.name: Mwakupha

texts.en:
Mwakupha is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to expand on the existing business. With the requested loan, he plans to add stock of flour, rice, sugar, and detergents. Since the last loan, he has increased his income by over 20%. 

Mwakupha is grateful to Kiva and Yehu for the support given. He hopes to expand his business and open new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, rice, sugar, and detergents.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name of Shoira lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works in a foreign country and earns a very small salary. They have two clever children, ages three and five. Shoira's children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but her income from sewing national dresses is not enough for it. She wants to repair her living house with modern planning. 

Shoira is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to repair her house. In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month, she will make her payments on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please help her and her family if it's possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as wood and cement, to repair her house.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe lives serenely in Magalalag. She has been a widow for almost five years now and has two young children. She carries the burden alone of giving them sustenance. She operates a small store, from as early as six o'clock in the morning until seven o'clock in the evening. On weekends, her children also help her in the business. She gains about 300 PHP daily doing these activities. She would like to keep extending good and affordable prices to her valued customers in order to help her achieve good sales. 

Maria Fe is now borrowing a loan of 50,000 PHP for additional capital to expand her business. She will buy more grocery items (biscuits, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, soap) to sell in her store. With strong determination and patience in her business, Maria hopes to achieve success in the business and will also bring welfare to her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items (biscuits, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, soap) to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 57 años de edad, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, una actividad que desarrolla desde muchos años atrás. Él vive junto a su esposa y seis hijos, de los cuales los mayores se dedican también a la agricultura. Ricardo es una persona muy agradecida con la vida ya que a pesar de muchas dificultades ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia, gracias a la comercialización de los granos básicos que producen. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de maíz y frijoles para sembrar, así mismo para la compra de pesticidas y abono que le garanticen la salud de los granos básicos y así sacarle provecho a todo el trabajo previamente realizado y vender el maíz y frijoles a muy buenos precios.
texts.en: 57-year-old Ricardo cultivates corn and beans, an activity that he has been developing for many years. He lives together with his wife and six children, of which the oldest children also work in agriculture. Ricardo is someone who is very thankful to life since, despite many difficulties, he has managed to get ahead together with his family, thanks to the staple foods they produce. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with the desire to have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of corn and beans to sow, as well as the purchase of pesticides and fertilizer that will guarantee the health of his crops. In this way, he will take advantage of all the work he has put in previously and sell the corn and beans at very good prices.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sow.

loans.name: José David

texts.es: José David es un señor  muy responsable quien vive junto a su compañera de vida y dos hijos menores de edad,  José se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, los cuales son dos de los principales alimentos de este país. José reside en una zona rural donde muchas personas se dedican al mismo oficio por lo que él debe esforzarse al máximo por brindar calidad en sus productos y de esta forma contar con clientes satisfechos. Es por esta razón que José solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar palas, arados, abono, pesticidas y semillas de frijoles y maíz para sembrar. De esta forma José espera aumentar su producción de granos básicos para posteriormente vender  por  mayor, actividad a la cual su esposa le ayuda. El préstamo otorgado por INTEGRAL, es muy importante para el crecimiento de su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en: José David is a very responsible man that lives together with his life partner and two minor children. José cultivates corn and beans, which are two of the principal foods of this country. José lives in a rural area where many people work in this same business, which means that he has to make every effort to provide quality products and, in this way, have satisfied clients. For this reason, José is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, with which he will be able to buy shovels, plows, fertilizer, pesticides and bean and corn seeds to sow. In this way, José hopes to increase his production of food staples in order to later sell them wholesale, an activity in which his wife helps him. The loan granted by INTEGRAL is very important for the growth of his business and the financial stability of his household.

loans.use: to buy tools to sow seeds.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: José Ángel de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y así mismo junto a sus tres pequeños hijos. José posee su propio negocio en el cual se dedica a elaborar ladrillos de barro que posteriormente comercializa en el centro de su lugar de residencia. Así mismo se dedica a la siembra de maíz, una actividad en la que posee mucha experiencia, José posee una parcela la cual es propicia para la siembra, la que le permite contar con muy buenas cosechas, lo que desea aprovechar al máximo duplicando la cantidad de maíz que siembra, por lo que solicita un préstamo a integral y de esta forma comprar semillas para sembrar, abono y pesticidas. José es muy trabajador quien vela por una mejora constante en su familia por lo que deposita sus esperanzas en dicho préstamo.
texts.en: 46-year-old José Ángel lives together with his wife, who takes care of the domestic work, and also with his three small children. José has his own business, in which he makes mud bricks that are later sold in the center of the place where he resides. He also grows corn, an activity in which he has much experience. José has a parcel of land that he owns for cultivation, which allows him to have good harvests, which he desires to take advantage of, doubling the quantity of corn that he sows. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Integral, with which he will buy seeds to sow, fertilizer and pesticides. José is a hard worker who watches out for a steady improvement in his family, which is why he is placing his hopes in said loan.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Golma Angélica

texts.es: Golma Angélica es una persona que siempre ha contado con grandes deseo de salir adelante y se ha esforzado por cumplir sus metas. Ella es madre soltera por lo que trabaja muy duro por brindarles lo mejor a sus dos hijos de uno y once años de edad. Golma se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles los cuales en parte son destinados para el consumo personal y así mismo para la comercialización de estos con mayoristas del pueblo en que ella reside. Golma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los insumos necesarios para la siembra como: abono, semilla de maíz y frijoles, con lo que podrán cultivar mucho más de lo que han podido hasta ahora, permitiéndoles percibir más ganancias.
texts.en: Golma Angélica is someone who has always had a strong desire to get ahead and endeavored to meet her goals. She is a single mother, so she works hard to provide the best to her two children, who are one and eleven years old. Golma is a farmer, sowing corn and beans, which are in part for home consumption and also for sale with wholesalers in the town where she resides. Golma is requesting a loan from Integral, with which she will be able to buy all the inputs necessary for cultivation, such as fertilizer and corn and bean seeds. With this, she will be able to cultivate much more than she has been able to up until now, allowing her to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Eliberto Lucio

texts.es: Eliberto Lucio de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su hogar y junto a sus dos hijos.  Él se dedica a sembrar maíz, un grano básico que tiene gran demanda en el país por lo que es un negocio muy estable, así mismo realiza diferentes trabajos de albañilería como reparación de techos, pequeñas construcciones, entre otros, lo que le permite contar con ganancias extras que son de mucho beneficio para su hogar. Eliberto solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz para sembrar y abono, con esto él aprovechara al máximo sus recursos y sembrar mucho más para esta temporada y así obtener más ganancias y hacer crecer la cantidad de cultivo, aprovechando al máximo su parcela.
texts.en: 50-year-old Eliberto Lucio lives together with his wife, a very responsible person dedicated to their home, and together with their two children. He cultivates corn, a staple food with a high demand in the country, and therefore a very stable business. He also undertakes various masonry jobs such as repairing roofs and small construction among others, which allows him to have some extra earnings that are very beneficial to his household. Eliberto is requesting a loan with which he will be able to buy corn to sow and fertilizer. With this, he will take make the most out of his resources and sow a lot more this season and in this way obtain greater earning and grow the quantity of his crop, taking the most advantage of his parcel of land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 28 years old. She is married to Patrick and together they are blessed with two children aged six and four years. Jacinta has been in the farming business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 11,000. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, sprays, etc. for her business.

Jacinta will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dream are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings, sprays, etc. for her farming business.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto  de 69 años de edad, es una persona que ha aprendido a salir adelante esforzándose y trabajando arduamente, él vive junto a su esposa y un hijo. Carlos se dedica a la siembra de caña, un producto  que cuenta con una amplia demanda ya que es utilizada para realizar la azúcar de consumo diario y así mismo para elaborar jugo de caña que es muy consumido por diferentes personas de distintas zonas del país. Así mismo se dedica a la elaboración de frenos y monturas para caballos en lo que posee mucha experiencia y varios clientes fijos que por más de 20 años han adquirido sus productos. Carlos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para el cultiva de caña y así mismo para contar con mano de obra que le ayude a sacar a tiempo todos los pedidos y de esta forma satisfacer a sus clientes, ya que de esta forma podrá contar con negocios fijos que sean de gran beneficios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is 69 years old; he is someone who learned to get through it by sparing no effort and working very hard. He lives with his wife and son. He grows sugar cane, a product which is in high demand since it is used to make not only everyday sugar, but sugar cane juice, which is drunk by many people from all over the country. Carlos Alberto also makes bits and saddles for horses, a trade in which he is very experienced: he has several regular customers who have been buying his wares for over twenty years. He asks the field partner for a loan in order to buy fertiliser and pesticides to grow sugar cane and to be able to hire people in order to deliver his orders in time and satisfy his customers. Thus, he will be able to have recurring customers, which will help him tremendously to earn enough to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Mekhriniso

texts.en:
Mekhriniso is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a very hard-working woman who always tries to provide her children with all modern conveniences. Mekhriniso has a lot of experience in animal husbandry as she has been involved since she was a child. After her marriage, she had very poor living conditions as her husband earned a small salary. Ten years ago, she bought a cow and, in this way, she began her own business dealing with animal husbandry. Now, she is one of the best and most successful businesswomen in the local market where she sells milk. 

Thanks to Mekhriniso's planning, her cows give good quality milk which attracts a lot of customers. She wants to buy more cows so she can develop her business but she doesn't have money to do so. Mekhriniso is requesting a loan of 1500 USD to buy cows. In this way, she will provide her family with high quality living conditions. She promises to make her repayments on time. Mekhriniso awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cows for her developing business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, aged 29, is single and the mother of one child. She runs a boutique shop in Kabarnet. This has been her income-generating business for the past three years from which she earns an average monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Mercy has borrowed a second loan of KES 25,000 after successfully repaying her previous loan. With this loan, she intends to purchase more clothing and other items to sell in her shop. She anticipates earning more profits which she will use to expand her business by increasing the number of items to meet her clients' demands.

Mercy hopes to improve her living standards and to be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and other items to sell

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 36 years old, is married and blessed with four children. He is a small-scale dairy farmer on the outskirts of Mogotio town. This has been his income-generating business for the past two years from which he earns an average monthly income of KES 14,500. 

Ezekiel has borrowed a sixth loan of KES 25,000 after successfully repaying his previous loans. With this loan, he intends to purchase a dairy cow. He anticipates earning more profits which he will use to expand his business by buying more dairy cows as well as saving some money for the future.

Ezekiel hopes to improve his living standards, to save money to enable him to pay his children's school fees as well as starting to keep sheep.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Salum is in his late twenties and is married. He has had a food business (selling rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour) for about two years now. He is really hard working. Salum works from 6am to 8pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his food stock and has successfully repaid his loan. Salum hopes for a loan to buy sacks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and beans. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group, Kitumbo, which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Mearch

texts.en:
Mearch is 51 years old and a responsible mother of seven children. Her four oldest children are already married while the youngest three are still single and help Mearch in a retail business. She operates a small convenience shop in her village in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She sells various kinds of household products, snack foods, sweets and spices, while her husband is in the business of trading firewood from a cow-pulled trailer. 

Recently, the sales volume of Mearch’s husband's business has decreased as he has been gradually going out of stock of firewood and he does not have enough capital to replace it. As a result, Mearch would like to take out a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase firewood in order to support her husband. This will enable him to sustain the business and stabilize his income. In the future, Mearch aspires to expand her business and hopes to provide her family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 50 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She distributes molasses, a business she started 11 years ago and from which she earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

Rosemary has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more of this product to sell. The anticipated profit will aid her in repaying her loan. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase molasses to sell.

loans.name: C8062 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Apolinaile, aged 48, is married with one adult child who is 21 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called "C8062 Abadacogora" in the local language. In the photo, she's the one who is in the blue dress

Apolinaile has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more onions to sell. With the profits expected from this loan, she will be able to reinvest in her business, to save money for her future and will be able to pay her adult child's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana, aged 40, is married and has three children: Siprianus, 17, who has graduated from senior high school; Kristin, 8, who is attending 2nd grade of elementary school; and Yohanes, 7, who is attending 1st grade of elementary school. 
 
Yuliana supports her family by running a piglet breeding business. She has been running this business for five years. At the moment, Yuliana has three piglets. She plans to buy four more piglets to fatten. When the pigs reach standard weight, then they are ready to be sold. Yuliana likes the piglet breeding business as it can generate a good profit for her and her family.

To implement her plan, Yuliana has requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She would like to purchase four piglets and fodder. She believes that the loan will motivate her to go forward.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and fodder

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, aged 43, is married to Julian and together they have five children aged 17, 14, 10, six and two years. He has been in the carpentry business for 12 years and currently earns a monthly income of KES 40,000.

The loan will be used to buy timber for sale through his business. The anticipated profits will be used to pay his children's school fees. This is Thomas's second loan with KADET LTD and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to open another carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy timber for sale through his carpentry business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general-store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, diapers, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items for her general-store business.

NWTF is relisting Evangeline's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, diapers, soft drinks and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Abdel Hasan

texts.en:
Abed Al Hasan is a 20-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single and lives with his family, including his parents and three siblings. His father is responsible for satisfying the family's needs and responding to their demands. 

Abdel Hasan and two of his siblings also work, hoping to take some responsibilities off of their father.  Abdel Hasan started his own business in 2009. He works independently in the construction field and has more than a few projects in the works.

Today, Abdel Hasan is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the necessary construction supplies that will enable him to carry on his work properly. He is sure that in a short period of time he will be able to gain great experience and move out of the country, enabling hims to take bigger projects with higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary construction supplies.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 40 years old and married with one child, age 2. He runs a pharmacy in the town of Moriba. After Issa went to a university to study pharmacy, there were no jobs. So he decided to start a business with the money his uncle gave him.  

Issa has been in this business for 10 years and sells medicines such as malaria treatment drugs, pain-reliever tabs and oral hydration salts at his house. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenges to his business are a lack of capital to expand his business and juggling demand with expiration dates.

Issa has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more medicine for his store. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to open a hospital. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines such as malaria treatment drugs, pain-reliever tabs and oral hydration salts.

loans.name: Renelita

texts.en:
Renelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. (Abaca is a species of banana native to the Philippines.)

Renelita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Renelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca-weaving business.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child, who is attending school. He has been a painter since 1999 and has become well-known among people in his community. Nabil's job is the only source of income for the family, so he works hard to earn as much as he can. As he wishes to enlarge his business, Nabil is planning to purchase new painting equipment so that he will be able to start working on a scheduled new project on time. 

That is why he has requested a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He is sure that this step will enable him to take more and bigger projects in the near future, and therefore achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase new painting equipment

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 38 years old. He is married to Ndinda and has four children, ages 9. 7, 4 and 1. 

He has been in the charcoal and motorcycle transport business for eight years. He currently has a monthly income of KES 10,000.

The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and also to repair his motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used to pay the school fees for his children and diversify his business venture.

This is Nicholas' second loan from KADET LTD. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. His dream is to own several motorcycles for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Jackin

texts.en:
Jackin is 39 years old, is married and supports a family of five. He runs a cereals store in Marigat town and this has been his income-generating business for the past 12 years. From this business, he earns an average monthly income of KES 14,000. 

Jackin has borrowed a fourth loan of KES 50,000 after successfully repaying his previous loans. With this loan, he intends to purchase cereals to sell in his store. He anticipates earning profits which he will use to expand his business by purchasing more cereals as he uses the rest of the profits to repay the loan. 

Jackin hopes to improve his living standards and save money to enable him to pay his children's school fees as well as to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to sell

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama continues in her farming business and she says that it is doing well. She has requested another loan so as to invest in her farming. Dama also plans to renovate her residential house since it is not in good condition. Due to insufficient funds to accomplish this, she has requested a loan so as to purchase iron sheets, fertiliser, and planting materials. Her aim is to open a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, fertiliser, and planting materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inputs for farming.

loans.name: Raúl Arnoldo

texts.es: Raúl Arnoldo de 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a trabajar la tierra, sembrando maíz y frijoles, los que posteriormente comercializa en diferentes lugares así mismo trabaja realizando diferentes productos de bálsamo como: cremas, shampo y más los cuales comercializa junto a su esposa en diferentes mercados y tiendas del lugar. Raúl solicita un préstamo a través  del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de semillas y de esta formar aumentar la cantidad  de producción de granos básicos y aprovechar al máximo su terreno, así de esta forma se asegurará obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales serán de mucho beneficio para su familia, ya que podrán contar con una vida estable, gracias a la venta de los granos básicos.
texts.en: Raúl Arnoldo, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three young children. He is dedicated to working the land, planting maize and beans, which he later sells in different places. He also works making different products from balm like creams, shampoo and more, which he sells with his wife in different markets and shops in the area. Raul is requesting a loan through which he'll have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of seeds and, this way, expand the quantity of production of basic grains and take the maximum advantage of his land and thus he will be sure to obtain better income, which will be very beneficial for his family since they will be able to have a stable life, thanks to the sale of basic grains.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant.

loans.name: Yous

texts.en:
Yous is 33 years old and lives in a rented room with her spouse in a suburban area of Phnom Penh. She is married and has two school-aged children.

To help her husband earn income, Yous has been operating a mobile business. Every day she uses her motorcycle (with a trailer behind her as shown in the picture) to go back and forth around her commune to sell soft drinks such as coffee, lemon tea, coca cola, sting (a type of drink), and pure drinking water. 

With her profits, she can pay for food, home bills, accommodation costs, and her children's expenses. Yous dreams of having her own house in Phnom Penh, which is why she has tried hard and saved money for that purpose.

Yous would like to obtain a loan to supplement her savings in order to purchase a plot of land for future housing purposes. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her as it’s her first loan through HKL. In the future, Yous plans to save more money to build a house on this land and help her two children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for future housing purposes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is from Tajikistan and loves her country very much. She is 39 years old, is divorced and has two children. To make a living, Elena sells honey at the market. Her goods are of high quality and attract a lot of customers. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years but earns little money from these activities. 

Elena works around eight hours a day at the local market. She thinks her business is going well because she is very kind and she always loves what she does.

Elena is requesting a loan of 7,000 TJS which will be used to buy more food items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel  de 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. María se dedica a la agricultura de maíz y frijoles un trabajo muy duro que logra sacar adelante junto a su familia y algunos jornaleros. Maribel es una persona muy conocida en la zona por ser trabajadora y responsable y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Maribel vela por el bienestar de su hogar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de pesticidas, abono, semillas de maíz y frijoles. Tanto Maribel como su esposo cuentan con varios clientes ya que son muy conocidos en la zona por realizar un excelente trabajo.
texts.en: Maribel, age 50, lives with her husband and their three children who help her with the business. She is dedicated to farming maize and beans, a very hard job which she manages to move forward with her her family and some workers. Maribel is a well known person in the area for being hard working and responsible and she has very good references from her neighbors. Maribel looks after the welfare of her home, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, with which she can have the necessary money to purchase pesticides, fertilizer, and maize and bean seeds. Both Maribel and her husband have many customers since they are already well known in the area for doing excellent work.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 36 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair extensions and hair treatments, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another salon. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions and hair treatments

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 52 years old. He is married to Gladys and together they have four children aged 29, 25, 27 and 22 years. He has been in the dairy farming business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

His loan will be used to purchase dairy feed for the animals and also to purchase a calf. The anticipated profits will be used to pay his children's college fees.

This is Richard's second loan from KADET LTD and he has successfully repaid the previous loan. His hopes and dream are to open a dairy milk centre.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed and a calf.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: This is Hasan, a 22 year old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings. Despite his young age, Hasan started to work on his own  in order to help his father, their one and only support, manage the family’s household expenses. Hasan is a specialist in the electrical systems of cars, specifically in car key programming. He’s a smart young man who has been involved in this profession two years ago. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and supplies such as batteries, keys, etc. His keen interest in his profession will improve the way he works. This is also the reason why he would like to expand his business. He would like to increase his income to support his family more.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and supplies such as batteries, keys, etc.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Alfred from Kulanda town in the southern district of Bo. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 10 years and 18 years. His children are attending school. 

Alfred runs a cinema center where he shows movies and football games, and he also sells generators. He has been running this business for 7 years. He works 14 hours every day and has 1 employee. The business is his only source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is an insufficient power supply to run his cinema center.

Alfred has requested a loan in order to buy a projector and more generators. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installments quickly and improve his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to open an electronics factory. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a projector and generators.

loans.name: Amparo Gladys

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante muchos años como empleada doméstica, Amparo decidió desde hace 5 años montar su propio negocio para poder estar más cerca de su hogar y así cuidar de sus 5 hijos. Fue entonces que una amiga le enseñó a preparar una gran variedad de comidas y comenzó a ofrecer el servicio de comidas a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. Actualmente su negocio sigue creciendo y gracias a la posibilidad de tener su propio negocio en su casa, puede ofrecerles a sus 5 hijos una mejor calidad de vida estando al cuidado de ellos, además que los ingresos para el hogar se han incrementado por la posibilidad de aportar una mayor cantidad junto con su esposo para sostener los gastos. Gracias a que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda comidas rápidas, Amparo busca un préstamo para comprar un carro de comidas rápidas con el que pueda preparar estas comidas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio siga creciendo para que sus hijos y su esposo puedan gozar de unos mejores ingresos en el hogar y así de una mejor calidad de vida. La esperanza de Amparo es que su negocio le permita brindarles a sus 5 hijos el acceso a una educación de buena calidad, y por esto es que trabaja fuertemente todos los días.
texts.en:
After working many years as a housemaid, Amparo decided five years ago to start her own business to be able to be closer to her home and take care of her five children. It was then that a friend taught her to make a great variety of food and she began to offer food service to her neighbors, family members and friends. Currently, her business keeps growing and, thanks to the possibility to have her own business in her house, she can offer her five children a better quality of life being their caregiver. Additionally, the income for the home has increased from the potential to contribute a greater quantity along with her husband to pay the bills. Thanks to her customers requesting that she sell fast food, Amparao is looking for a loan to buy a fast food cart with which she can prepare food and satisfy her customers' needs.

Her greatest dream is that this business keeps growing so that her children and her husband can enjoy better income in the house and a better quality of life. Amparo's hope is that her business allows her to provide for her five children the access to a good quality education and it is for this that she works so hard every day.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart with which she can prepare food and satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung is 59 years old, is married, and has three children, two of whom are living with her under the same roof in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to agricultural businesses, including farming and hog-raising. Through these businesses, she has earned her income from which she has been able to support her daily living. Her children serve as her motivation in these businesses. 

Doung’s husband operates a firewood selling business in which he uses a trailer pulled by buffalo to transport the firewood, earning around 22,000 KHR per day.

Doung would like to improve her farming practices and have better crop yields in coming years. She is now asking for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase a plow for farming purposes. Cambodian people also use plows to connect at the back of a trailer to move things from place to place. In this particular way, it will help Doung’s husband to quickly transport his firewood to the marketplaces.

loans.use: to purchase a plow for farming purposes.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 38 years old. He is married to Rose and together they have four children, aged 15, 12, 11, and 8 years.

Richard has been in the charcoal business for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. This loan will be used to buy more stock for the business.

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children. This is his second loan with KADET, and the previous loan has been successfully repaid. His hope and dream is to become a wholesale charcoal supplier.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal  to sell.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yehya is a 24-year-old Lebanese man. He’s engaged to a sweet young lady and looks forward to getting married and having children. He is still living with his parents and two siblings. With his father working and the support of his sibling, Yehya has capably managed the family household in order to improve their standard of living. 

Yehya had many years of experience as a car mechanic before deciding to open his own garage. Because he wishes to further develop his business, Yehya is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new scanner machine. This step will facilitate his business, allowing him to receive more clients who will be served rapidly. Yehya just started his career, so another Kiva loan will be a good way for him to expand his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a new scanner machine

loans.name: Zoran

texts.en:
Zoran, who lives in a Serbian community in Kosovo, is married and the father of two adult children. For more than 10 years, Zoran has been providing transportation services, the only source of income for his family. His business and client base are growing steadily, and he has a good reputation in the community.

Zoran's van recently broke down, and he is requesting his first loan from KosInvest to pay for the costs of a new engine and its installation. His goal is to expand his business, to buy another van and to employ his son.

Zoran hopes to stay in good health and to keep making his own living in order not to have to ask for help from others. He is very happy for this support!

loans.use: to pay the costs for a new engine van and its installation.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora que ha logrado ir saliendo adelante poco a poco de la situación económica que acompañaba a su familia anteriormente, pues proviene de una familia con grandes dificultades económicas y ahora con su negocio ha podido ofrecerles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace un tiempo montó su propio taller de confección con unas máquinas básicas donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros; y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ahora tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de varias empresas, lo que le permite tener unos ingresos con los cuales sostener su hogar y ofrecer a sus padres una buena calidad de vida. A pesar de las grandes dificultades que le ha presentado la vida, Maria Isabel siempre ha sido muy alegre y luchadora, y esforzándose todos los días ha logrado superar estas dificultades y continuar progresando. Actualmente tiene el sueño de fabricar su línea propia de prendas de vestir, y por esto busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos para fabricar su línea propia de prendas de vestir.

Maria Isabel anhela que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y su taller también siga creciendo, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar y también poder ofrecer empleo a las personas más necesitadas en su taller.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a very entrepreneurial and hard working person who has managed to move forward gradually from the economic situation that accompanied her family previously since she comes from a family with great economic difficulties and now, with her business, she has been able to offer her parents a better quality of life. Some time ago she started her own shop with some basic machines where she offered the service of making clothes and, thanks to the good quality of her products, now she has very good orders from various companies which allows her to have some income which supports her home and offers her parents a good quality of life. Despite the great hardship that she has faced in life, Maria Isabel always has been very happy and hard working and, from working every day, has managed to overcome those difficulties and continues to progress. Currently, she dreams to make her own clothing line and for this she is looking for a loan to buy materials like fabric and thread to make her own clothing line.

Maria Isabel long that in this manner her income will increase considerably and her shop will also keep growing so she can have a greater quality of life and also be able to offer jobs in her shop to the people who need them most.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fabric and thread to make her own line of clothing.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So lives in Reussey Keo district where she operates a laundry business from her own house. Through this business, she is able to make approximately USD 7.00 each day to cover her daily costs. So is 56 years old and single.

So would like to repair some parts of her house due to its disrepair and age. She is now requesting a loan of 600 USD to add to her savings to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand and small stones, and to pay for labor costs. This is her fifth loan cycle through HKL. With the four previous loans which she has completely repaid, So mentioned that she could improve her business as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand and small stones, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jebeh

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Jebeh from Kandeh town in the southern district of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children, aged 11 years and 18 years. Her children are currently attending school.

Jebeh sells local foodstuffs within a busy market area; she sells palm oil, gari (cassava meal), and cola nut. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day, 11 hours a day. She wakes up at 5:00 am and travels to neighboring villages to buy her stock of local food. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network serving her village.

Jebeh has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, gari, and cola nut. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to become a supplier to other partners. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, gari, and cola nut

loans.name: Daynah

texts.en:
Daynah works hard to support her family. She is married and sells firewood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Daynah has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more wood to sell to her customers.

In the future, Daynah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
