La meta final de Enrique es montar su propio taller con buena ubicación y servicios y productos variados.
texts.en:
Enrique, 65, was born in Alausí but lives in Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo is one of Ecuador's largest cities and has a humid climate. It is strategically located between the coast and the mountains, and, therefore, has experienced rapid growth in recent decades. Farming and commerce are the city's principal activities, and its economic growth has spurred a variety of sectors that have enriched the community.

Enrique started his business 10 years ago and has enjoyed considerable success. He is requesting a loan to invest in machinery, in particular, a circular saw to help him cut and create wood designs faster. Enrique works on average 8 hours a day, but he feels he has reached the point at which he must invest to grow and increase his income. His goal is to open a well-stocked workshop in a good location.

loans.use: to invest in machinery, in particular, a circular saw to help him cut and create wood designs faster.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun is a 28-year-old married man. He peacefully lives with his wife and three children in Ang Snoul District, Kandal Province. Vun is employed on the sales staff of a company that offers farm supplies in Phnom Penh. He gets paid monthly but he also can earn a daily wage due to his good communication with existing and new customers. Vun is glad that his wife supports him in generating income to uplift their living conditions by being dedicated to a farming and livestock-raising business.

Vun would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 1,500 USD to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand, and zinc to renovate his present house. Vun hopes to have a suitable home for his family. For his business goal, Vun anticipates that he can own a big poultry farm in his village someday.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand, and zinc to renovate his present house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to repair her motorcycle transport. Mercedita has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair her motorcycle transport

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco habitante de Colonia Talolinga desde hace  5 años tiene establecido su propio negocio de Laboratorio Dental el cual se encuentra ubicado en su misma localidad de residencia, este joven brinda servicio en todo tipo de trabajos dentales, actividad que se constituye como su principal fuente de  ingreso para el bienestar de su familia, su esposa  colabora en los quehaceres del hogar, nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion, para realizar un pozo lo que incluye excabacion, brocal, caseta y bomba lo que le permitira tener agua en todo tiempo, garantizando gozar de mejores condiciones de vida, espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva la llevar a cabo su proyecto.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Francisco, a resident of Colonia Talolinga, started his own business, Laboratorio Dental, in his home. He offer all types of dental services, which is his family's main source of income. His wife attends to the household chores.

Francisco needs this loan for materials and equipment to build a well, including excavating and placing the parapet, stall, and pump so that there is always a water supply, which provides better living conditions for his family. He hopes to undertake this project with support from Kiva microfinance lenders.

loans.use: to build a well.

loans.name: Las Joyitas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Joyitas” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de joyas, venta de manzanas, pasteles, venta de lanas, feriantes, venta de leña, servicios entre otro. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Sylvia, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color café, lleva una cartera de color café, alrededor de  su cuello usa una bufanda de color blanco, en sus manos sostiene una carpeta y su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio específicamente en cafetería, desde hace 15 años. Se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a viernes desde las 08ºº hasta las 15ºº horas.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un letrero para su local.
Una de las metas de Sylvia es vender 3 veces más la cantidad habitual de sus cafés, tiene bastante clientela, pero quiere seguir captando para  crecer aún más, para generar mayores ingresos, ya que con estos recursos apoya al hogar y el bienestar de su hija.
Sylvia vive junto a su marido y su hija de 11 años de edad. Uno de sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener la posibilidad de viajar con su hija fuera del país.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que es  muy unido y existe generosidad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Las Joyitas and is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work as merchants, specifically selling clothes, jewelry, apples, cakes, wool, traveling sales, firewood, and other services. All of them live in Temuco.

Sylvia is a member of the communal bank and can be found in the photograph standing in the front row, 4th person from right to left, wearing a brown jacket, with a brown purse, with a white scarf around her neck, holding a folder in her hands, and her dark brown hair pulled back.

She has been working in the field of commerce, specifically in food service, for 15 years. She works Monday through Friday from 8:00AM until 3:00PM. She usually buys her food at supermarkets and distributors at a low cost, which is financially desirable. With the loan she will buy a sign for her facility.

One of Sylvia’s goals is to sell 3 times the usual amount of her sales. She has enough customers, but she wants to continue attracting more in order to grow and in order to generate more profits as these resources support the household and the welfare of her daughter.

Silvia lives with her husband and her daughter who is 11 years old. One of her dreams for the family is to have the possibility to travel with her daughter outside the country. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza since it permits her to invest in her business. In regards to the communal bank of which she is a member, she says that it is very close-knit and generous.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile). The surrounding area contains a number of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and native flora and fauna which is very stunning, concentrated in nearby nature parks. It should be pointed out that 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people of our country live in this region.

loans.use: to buy a sign for her facility

loans.name: Cynthia Estefanía

texts.es:
Cynthia vive en Quininde. Este cantón está en la provincia de Esmeraldas, ubicada en la Costa Norte del Ecuador. En la historia ha sido un buen proveedor de banano, café y cacao y actualmente es uno de los mayores productores de palma africana y recursos forestales. Quinide cuenta con un clima tropical lluvioso. La ciudad tiene 150000 habitantes. La ciudad tiene un ecosistema bastante diverso por lo tanto tiene varias reservas ecológicas. 
Con tan solo 20 años, Cynthia ya tiene su propio negocio de venta de maquillaje a catálogo. Ella decidió crear este emprendimiento hace dos años y poco a poco lo hice su mayor fuente de ingresos. Cynthia tiene fe en su negocio y quiere que crezca para tener una fuente de ingresos más estable. Cythia terminó sus estudios secundarios y quiere poder continuar con sus superiores, por lo tanto pide un préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar más productos y reducir el costo unitario de cada uno. Así, ella podrá ahorrar para cumplir sus sueños a futuro.
texts.en:
Cynthia lives in Quininde, a canton of Esmeraldas province located along Ecuador's north coast. The area, which historically produced banana, coffee, and cacao, is now one of the main producers of African palm oil and forestry products. Quinide has a tropical, rainy climate; 15000 residents; and a diverse ecosystem and several ecological reserves.

Though she is just 20, Cynthia has her own business, selling makeup through catalogs, which she started two years ago and has slowly become a great income source. Cynthia has faith in her business and wants to grow it so that it provides more stable income. She finished secondary school and wishes to continue her studies. She is requesting a loan to to purchase more products at lower costs, which will allow her to save and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more products at lower costs.

loans.name: Juan Bento

texts.es: El sr Juan esta  casado con norma Leticia desde ya casi 30 años, tienen un  negocio de abarrotes  y con su negocio lleva ya 10 años de servicio. En esta ocasión solicita que se le apoye para comprar más mercancía para su negocio ya que quiere expandir a mas variedad en productos a ofrecer a sus clientes porque la competencia es muy fuerte y necesita para poder seguir teniendo ingresos para solventar sus gastos. Su esposa ha estado a su lado durante todo este tiempo apoyando el negocio familiar ya que es una forma de convivir y pasar tiempo juntos.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan has been married to Norma Leticia for almost 30 years. They have a grocery store business and have been providing service to customers for 10 years. At this time, he is applying for assistance in purchasing more merchandise for his business since he wants to expand his inventory to include a greater variety of products for his clients because the competition is fierce and he needs to continue earning an income to pay expenses.

His wife has been at his side during all of this time, both to support the family business and because this is a way for them to spend time together.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina es una mujer de 64 años, ella es casada con Ramiro de 77 años. Actualmente los dos viven en Santo Domingo y mantienen a tres hijos. Santo Domingo es una ciudad de clima tropical cálido, ubicada en el centro de Ecuador uniendo la costa y la sierra a través de la cordillera. Santo Domingo ha experimentado un crecimiento económico bastante acelerado en los últimos años lo que a su vez ha creado oportunidades de trabajo inexistentes anteriormente, sin embargo debido a esto también ha crecido mucho el crimen, y en los últimos años se ha notado la presencia del narcotráfico y el sicariato.
En medio de esta ciudad surgen Celina y Ramiro, Celina solicita un préstamo por primera vez, ella tiene una pequeña finca donde crece diferentes cultivos. Celina considera que ha llegado el momento en el cual puede invertir un poco para crecer su capacidad y hacer ciertos arreglos necesarios. Celina actualmente trabaja un promedio de diez horas al día, pero con este préstamo si lo consigue va a lograr expandir su capacidad y mejorar sus ingresos para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Celina is a 64 years old woman, married with Ramiro who is 77 years old. Currently, the two live in Santo Domingo and support three children. 

Santo Domingo is a city of warm tropical climate, located in central Ecuador, linking the coast and the mountains through a mountain range. Santo Domingo has experienced a very rapid economic growth in the last years, which in turn has created job opportunities, non-existent previously. However, because of that, crime has also grown. In recent years, there's been the presence of drug trafficking and contract killings.

In the middle of this city is where Celina and Ramiro appear. Celina is applying for a loan for the first time. She has a small farm where she cultivates different crops. Celina believes that now is the time to invest a little to improve her capacity and make certain repairs. Celina currently works an average of ten hours per day. With the loan, she hopes to expand her capacity and improve her income for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to make some repairs

loans.name: Grace Veronica

texts.es: Grace es una madre luchadora y emprendedora la cual inicio su negocio empujada por la necesidad de brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Es en el sector de la Isla Trinitaria donde tiene su restaurant el cual atiende con la ayudad de sus hijos. Escogió esta actividad porque le gusta cocinar porque investigo dándose cuenta que deja mejores ganancias que cualquier otro negocio. Su horario de atención es el normal desde las 8 de la mañana ofreciendo desayunos hasta las 3 de la tarde, no se queda más tiempo porque le podría resultar peligroso y no le gustaría que la delincuencia la vea como blanco de robos. Los platos que más le solicitan es el pollo frito, pescado frito y carne asada los cuales vende a $ 2.00 el plato. Como fue hace varios años que inicio su negocio le gustaría reformar un poco el área de la cocina es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina nueva industrial, ollas, colas. Su sueño a futuro es poder abrir 2 locales comerciales propios uno para cada unos de sus hijos y que continúen con el negocio por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking, enterprising mother who started her business because she wanted to offer her children a brighter future. Her restaurant, which she manages with her children's help, is located in Isla Trinitaria. She chose this business because she loves to cook and it generates more profit than any other. The business usually opens at 8 a.m. for breakfast and closes at 3 p.m. It is dangerous to stay open later; it bothers Grace to see crimes in the area like robbery. 

Fried chicken, fried seafood, and grilled meats, which she offers at $2 each, are her most popular dishes. Since she started her business some years ago, she would like to remodel the kitchen. She is requesting a loan to buy a new industrial stove, pots, and pans. She dreams of opening 2 more locations, one for each of her children, and to keep growing her business for many years.

loans.use: to buy a new industrial stove, pots, and pans.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is 43 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 18 and the youngest is 10. 

She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for five years now. She sells basic household items like candies, rice, school supplies, seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and toiletries to the people in her community. She usually earns 3,000 PHP per month.

She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies of candies, rice, school supplies, seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and toiletries, of which she sells the most on a daily basis. 

In the future, Alyn hopes to make her store bigger and offer more merchandise to her customers for a better income.

loans.use: to buy candies, rice, school supplies, seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for tacos.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years of age, married, and has only one child. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker in Canada. With the help of her husband, they are able to educate their only child and sustain their daily needs.

Jocelyn would like to earn independently, so she focuses herself on running her handicraft business. At this time, she has four helpers in making home-made plastic baskets, shoulder bags, and fruit trays. She is really grateful because of the blessings she has. According to her, she is able to make six shoulder bags and ten fruit trays a day.  

Her business is growing, so she is also in need of additional capital to develop the quality of her products and to make more stock. With her determination in life, she is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP 35,000. She hopes to obtain this amount to be able to increase her income and employ more people to work with her handicraft business.

loans.use: to buy more plastic straps for her home-made handicrafts basket business.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn (pictured here), age 57, makes and sells typical Cambodian cake in front of a garment factory. Her husband, Sam Oeun, age 46, is a farmer and raises cows at home. 

They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have four children, one son and three daughters. One is married and lives separately, two attend school, and another one assists in her mother’s business. 

Yorn is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom (in the photo) is 27 years old and her husband, Kamsun, is 30 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, and they have two young children, one son and one daughter. 

Yom is a garment worker, while her husband is hired to grow mushrooms and gets paid with fees.

Yom is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a married mother of three children ages 18, 22 and 27, is from the town of Talibon, Bohol where she and her husband work together in their fishing business to earn an income.

Now requesting a loan to pay for gasoline for their boat, fish hooks and fishing net repairs, Rosita plans to expand their business and acquire boats to earn a better income in order to better support the family's needs for food and school fees.

loans.use: to pay for fish hooks, fishing net repairs, and gasoline for their boat.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years of age and has four children. All her children have finished their education through the profit gained from her direct selling business.

Juliet runs and has operated her direct selling business for three years. With her patience and hard work, she is able to sustain their basic commodities in life. Aside from direct selling, she has also involved herself in a hog raising business. 

Juliet would like to add more products such as shoes, cosmetics, and clothing to her stall, but her income is not enough due to her expenses in her hog raising business. So, she is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan. 

She believes that through this requested loan, she will be able to provide good quality service to her customers and be able to encourage more customers to buy her products. In this way, she could gain more income to sustain her family’s daily needs and save some for emergency purposes when she got weak.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business through putting up another branch near her village.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as shoes, cosmetics, and clothing for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria Jose de 43 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de moto taxi ( que consisten trasportar a las personas con un asiento en la parte delantera de la moto), el negocio lo tiene hace 2 años que  surgió la idea, ya que se agrupo con uno vecinos y formaron una cooperativa de dicho servicio, en la actualidad el negocio se ha incrementado gracias a la aceptación de la ciudadanía ya que le resulta un medio de transporte mas económico, su sueños y metas es llegar a formar a sus dos hijos ya que en la actualidad están estudiando en la universidad. El financiamiento lo necesita para darle mantenimiento a los moto taxi y brindar un mejor servicio a la población.
texts.en: Maria Jose is forty-three years old, married, and has two children who are of age. For work she offers a motor rickshaw service (that consists of transporting people with a seat in the front part of the motor rickshaw. She's had the business for two years when the idea emerged after she got together with some neighbors and they formed a cooperative providing said service. Currently the business has grown thanks to its acceptance by the citizens as it's a cheaper means of transport. Her dreams and goals are to educate her two children since they are currently studying in college. She needs the funding to provide maintenance for the motor rickshaws and offer better service to the population.

loans.use: to buy and provide maintenance for her motor rickshaw and offer better service to the population.

loans.name: Ma. Celiet

texts.en:
Ma. Celiet is a 29 year-old married woman from the town of Talibon in the province of Bohol. She has two children, ages eight and nine. 
Ma. Celiet and her husband work together to raise their family through a fishing business. Their fishing business has been in existence for 8 years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy fish hooks, gasoline, fish net and school supplies for her children. Ma. Celiet plans to make her business a success and expand her fishing for a better income, so she can support her children’s studies. 

In the future, she hopes to have another boat that they can use for fishing, for a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy fish hooks, gasoline, fish net and school supplies

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna (pictured with her loom) and her husband are silk weavers. They also do a farming business when farming season comes. To earn additional income, Sokna’s husband does construction work when he is free. 

Sokna has been married since 2006 and she has one young son. She lives in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokna has asked for Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea (pictured with her loom), age 41, is a weaver. Her husband, Chhit, age 42, is a farmer. Thea also helps in her husband’s farming when farming season comes. 

Thea and her husband have been married since 1990 and have three sons and one daughter. One is a driver, another one works in a factory that produces ice and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thea is applying for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy a motorized hand tiller to assist in her farm. Because her old motorized hand tiller breaks and does not work well, she decided to sell it. She will use the loan to add to money from selling her old motorized hand tiller to buy a new one.

loans.use: To buy new motorized hand tiller to assist in her farm.

loans.name: Anita Jomaira

texts.es: Anita es una madre soltera de 2 hermosos niños, en su domicilio tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual cubre sus gastos. La tienda la inicio hace varios años y le ayudo un hermano quien migro al extranjero, gracias a su apoyo pudo empezar el negocio el cual poco a poco ha ido en aumento. Ella atiende al público desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche no tiene horario de descanso ya que vive ahí y cuida de sus hijos. una de sus mayores preocupaciones son los accidentes ya que su casa está ubicada en un sector concurrido y a tenido varias malas experiencias, como por ejemplo cuando un conductor ebrio choco contra su casa y destruyo el negocio y parte de su casa, como estaba embarazada se llevo una fuerte impresión. Gracias a Dios se pudo recuperar y continuar trabajando para recuperar lo perdido es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, víveres, enlatados etc., también necesita una vitrina y la construcción de varias perchas. Espera continuar con su negocio por largo tiempo ya que le gustaría arreglar su casa y local para brindarles un futuro más prometedor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anita is the single mother of two beautiful children. She has a grocery store in her home with which she covers her expenses. She started the store several years with the help of a brother who emigrated abroad. Thanks to his help she was able to open the business which she has slowly expanded. 

She waits on the public from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. She does not have a rest period because she lives there and takes care of her children. 

One of her greatest worries is accidents because her house is located in a busy area and she has had several bad experiences as, for example, when a drunk driver crashed into her house and destroyed her business and part of her home. Since she was pregnant at the time the incident left a strong impression on her. Thank God she was able to recover and continue working to make up the loss. That is why she is applying for a loan to purchase products such as rice, sugar, provisions, canned goods, etc. She also needs a display case and to build several cabinets. 

She hopes to continue with her business for a long time because she would like to refurbish her house and store in order to provide a more promising future for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, provisions, canned goods, a display case and cabinets.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny (pictured above), age 21, is a garment worker. Her husband, Sabath, age 42, is a solder. They have been married since 2011 and have no child yet. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.
  
Vanny want to start new business selling sausage, she will stop working as a garment worker. But, she does not have capital to launch the business. That’s why she decides to apply for a loan to help her capital.

loans.use: To launch new business selling sausage.

loans.name: Chinsotheary

texts.en:
Chinsotheary (pictured here) is 29 years old and her husband, Kin is 37 years old, living in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2008 and have two young children-one son and one daughter. 

Chinsotheary stays at home and takes care of her children. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary, who is a policeman. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to build a fence around her house. 

With fence around which will build with money from the loan, will protect Chinsotheary’s elements against thieves stealing household items and prevent her land property.

loans.use: To build a fence around of her house.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng, age 32, is a construction worker. His wife, Samphors, age 27, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2008 and have no children yet. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Meng asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to raise. He will get extra income from selling calf when the cow gives a baby.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Sreyrath

texts.en:
Sreyrath (pictured above) is 29 years old and her husband, Sambath is 31 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have three young sons. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.
  
Sreyrath is a garment worker, while her husband is a driver. She is asking for her first Kiva loan in order to buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha is a silk weaver.  She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then sells them in a Phnom Penh market. Sopha is single and she is living with her mother and sister in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sopha is asking for a loan of $1,000 to continue her silk weaving business by buying silk materials.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a very jovial and active woman who is 35 years of age. She is married and has three children who are in school. Pamela has operated a vegetable stall for some time but she decided to increase her routes and include a fish selling business, where she sells her fish at the market. She dreams of opening a retail shop in future. Pamela has run out of stock funds to invest it in her business.
With this requested loan, she will buy fish, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy fish, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 35 years old a good wife that full of dreams in life especially to her future children. She is still hoping that at her age she will soon bless with child. Now, she focuses in her bakery business where she gets all the expenses in their everyday living. She also helps her parent in terms of economically that’s why she needs to earn more. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 as additional fund to rotate in her bakery. It will be use to purchase 2 sacks of flour, baking powder and yeast. She hopes to earn higher income this time for the financial security purposes of her business and family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of flour, baking powder and yeast

loans.name: Kev

texts.en: Kev is 48 years old. He lives with his family in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kampong Tom province. He has seven children: five of them are still single and live under the same roof with Kev while the other three are married already and lives separately around the province. Kev has been operating farming and fishing business for the primary source of his income. He has a great support from his wife and children. To uplift his living status and satisfy his family, Kev aims to generate a transportation business for his son, and thereby increase their household income. With regard to this, Kev has applied for additional capital to purchase a motorcycle for his son starting up a new transportation business. Kev wishes to keep supporting the education some of his children because he wants them to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his son starting up a new transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a welding machine for welding business

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a 28 year old married woman with two children. She is managing a retail shop which she likes to restock it with the basic ingredients. Tabu is married to Jackson who is self employed and together they operate the retail shop, selling a variety of consumer goods. She describes market competition as her major challenge.
Her cry is to see all her children become professionals. Her inventory has gone down and she wants to restock it. With the loan,  she will be able to purchase maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
In the town of Samburu, we meet Christine living happily with her family; her husband and their three children who are all attending a local school. Christine is a loving woman who cares for her family. She does not want to see her children lack any basic need.
For the past six years, Christine has operated a tailoring business serving the local people. She is aiming at opening a retail shop in the near future. In addition to this, she has a green grocery located opposite her house. Demand for clothes of different styles has increased and she does not want to let her customers down. So she is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 20,000 to purchase clothing materials and sewing threads.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and sewing threads.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en: Amgalan, 45 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husbund helps with her business and her daughter is a college student.  Amgalan started her clothes trading business on rental counters in 2000.  Nowadays,  she owns two rental counters. Her business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. During the new session, her business demand increases. Thus, she wants to buy more products she sells in order to increase business income as well as profit.  She needs 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more products from Erlian.  She is a hardworking and hilarious woman who says 'My daughter will soon join to college. So I have to prepare for my daughter tuition.'

loans.use: To purchase more products from Erlian

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a hardworking woman who has shown interest in getting ahead in life. She was able to purchase a motorcycle through her previous loan, which provides her with monthly income.

Tabu is taking out another loan so she can start a poultry business, rearing chickens.  She will use this loan to purchase the chickens she needs.

Her aim is to own several businesses that together will generate good income. She says that thanks to her hard worrk, she has been able to cater to the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela is 47 years old and married, with two children.  She resides at Gata Daku, Clarin. 

Ramela owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this work. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Ramela joined GDMPC this year. 

In the future, Ramela wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for raising rice.

loans.name: Guillermina Veronica

texts.es: Guillermina de 29 años de edad,  casada con un hijo menor de edad, tiene por actividad  económica la  venta de ropa nueva, la cual lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la localidad, tiempo de tener el negocio 6 años , el negocio inicio por la ayuda de su mama la cual ya tenia experiencia en dicha actividad, en la actualidad sus objetivos y metas son incrementar su negocio y cambiar el zinc de su casa, el financiamiento lo quiere para  comprar  ropa como: pantalones, camisas, short, vestidos, faldas, capris, entre otros.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 29 years old. She is married with a child who is of dependent age. For work she sells new clothing. She has her locale set up in her neighborhood market and has had this business for six years. She started the business up with her mother's help, who already had experience in this work. 

Currently, her objectives and goals are to expand her business and replace her house's roof. With this loan she wants to buy clothing including pants, shirts, shorts, dresses, skirts and capris, among other items.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, dresses, skirts and capris, among other items.

loans.name: Rengie

texts.en:
Rengie is 35 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Rengie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Rengie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from fattening pigs. Rengie hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD ,after repaying the previous loan successfully. Beth will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm produce and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Horace

texts.en: Horace is already 59 and yet very capable in managing her own business in the village of Lasam. She has a small place allotted in their market where she sells different kind of meats such as pork and beef. This serves as their main source of income. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month for this activity. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase meat to sell. She hopes for additional income this time in order to save as a reserve for future emergencies as well as development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Backshop

texts.en:
Backshop is 54 years old married to Jane they are blessed with two children, his wife also sells  second hand clothes. He has been in business for seven years which he earns a monthly income of KES.30,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to expand his business by buying more men suits for sale in the profit he gets he will help him buy a plot. He dreams to create more jobs for others.

loans.use: To buy more men suits for sale

loans.name: Njira

texts.en: Njira is a woman of integrity and a great merchant. She has been managing a retail shop for over five years. She also has a motorcycle where she has hired someone to operate it. Njira has been a member of Yehu since 2010 and has been one of the beneficiaries of Yehu loans, this being her second loan. Thanks to her hardwork she has been able to cater for the needs of her family. Her business goal is to open a wholesale in future. Njira has been in this line of business for the last seven years, previously busy in farming. She has requested a loan in the amount of Ksh 40,000 to add stock of flour, beverages such as juice and sodas, and other fast selling products.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, beverages such as juice and sodas, and other fast selling products.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 38 years old married and he supports a family of six. He runs retail shop in Kabarnet town and this has been his income generating business for the last three years where he gets an average monthly income of Kshs 9,000. 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES. 30,000 after successfully paying his previous loan. With this loan he intends to purchase more items i.e. sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps and washing powders among others. He anticipates of getting profits of which he will use to expand his business by increase more items to meet his clients demand.

Tito hopes to improve his living standards by using part of his profits to furnish his house as well as buy furniture, he also strives to  be financially stable and save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more items i.e. sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps and washing powders

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 49, widowed and the mother of six, two of who are in school earns a living through the sell of groceries in her grocery stall. She stocks various fruits and vegetables including bananas, tomatoes, kales, etc. Fatuma plans to expand this stall so as to increase her income. She is an enterprising woman who knows how to relate with customers well. This has made her to increase her clientele. Fatuma has taken and repaid two loans from Yehu so she has a good credit reference.
She intends to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. This will make her earn good income even as she attends to serve her customers with good services.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en: Battur is 36 years old and lives with his mother and his sister's two children in an old small house of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is disabled.  His sister passed away few years ago. His mother retired. His sister's children are secondary school students. He started his handicraft businesses with his younger brother in 2002. He paints a picture on leather. He sells his products in the state department store and other souvenir's shops. Today, Battur has been well-experienced in handicraft business in his town residents appreciates him as a hardworking and diligent man. He is planning to export his products to China and expand his business. He requesting 3,800,000 to hire employees, to make16 pictures.

loans.use: To hire employees, to make 16 pictures

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 46 years old and married.  She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Felisa plants, harvests, and sells bananas.  She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of farming. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Felisa joined GDMPC this year. 

In the future, Felisa wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta, 52 years old, is married and has three children. She resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 10 years, Jacinta has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of PHP 6,710 from the business.

Jacinta has requested a loan of PHP 8,100 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. Jacinta been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Tengan todos ustedes muy Buenos Días!, reciban cálidos saludos de todos los peruanos. Isolina es una de las socias del Grupo MARAVILLAS, que lleva ya casi 6 meses de conocerse, está conformado por 10 socios, entre ellos tres varones, todos ellos independientes, administran su propio negocio.
Isolina tiene 39 años, convive con el padre de sus 3 hijos, 2 de ellos en edad escolar, el último de apenas 1 año, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, con ganas de surgir y apoyar a la mantención del hogar con los ingresos que obtiene de su pequeño salón de Belleza, ubicada en un su propia casa.
Isolina, también se dedica a la agricultura y cría animales menores en pequeña cantidad  (cuy, gallinas, conejos, etc.)Que le genera algunos ingresos eventuales.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de tintes, shampoo, acondicionador, etc., ya que como se aproximan fechas festivas en su localidad, incrementa la visita de sus clientas.
Isolina se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo que EDAPROSPO y equipo de KIVA le está brindando para que pueda crecer su negocio y cumplir con su sueño que es el de poder alquilar un local apropiado para su Salón de Belleza, y poder brindar un buen servicio a sus asiduas clientas.
Isolina es la tercera de la izquierda, viste con un chaleco color plomo, polo fucsia y lleva puesta una gorra de color azul. * En la parte superior se encuentra Ángel con una camisa celeste y Crisly con una chompa negra.
texts.en:
Have you all a good morning! Receive warm greetings from all Peruvians. 

Isolina is one of the members of the Grupo Maravillas, which is almost six months old and is formed by ten members, including three men. All of them are independent and they run their own businesses. 

Isolina is 39 years old and lives with the father of her three children, two of them schoolchildren and the last of only one year old. She is an entrepreneurial woman, wanting to be successful and support the maintenance of the household with her income from her small beauty salon, located in her home. Isolina is also engaged in farming and raising small animals in small quantities (guinea pigs, chickens, rabbits, etc.) that provides her with casual income. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioner, etc. because festivities in her town are approaching and that increases the visit of her clients. Isolina is very grateful for the support EDAPROSPO and the team of Kiva is giving her to grow her business. She hopes to fulfil her dream of renting a better place for her Beauty Salon, so she can provide a good service to her assiduous clients.

Isolina is the third from the left, dressed in a gray vest, a pink sweater and a blue cap. At the top, there are Angel with a blue shirt and Crisly with a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Kamwana

texts.en:
Kamwana is single and she has two children, 13 and 18 years old. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. For more than 5 years, Kamwana has operated a kiosk where she sells consumer goods. Her business is located at a strategic area and her primary customers are local residents.

Kamwana describes her biggest business challenge as the high transportation cost of goods from their source to her business premises. She will use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of flour, sugar, and small fast-selling products to resell. Kamwana's business goal is to venture into a bigger retail shop since she currently sells in a small store.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, and small fast-selling products

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil, 33 years old, is single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the last five years, he has earned a living by cultivating coconuts. He earns about PHP 6,800 a month. Ramil joined GDMPC in 2011. He has asked for a loan of PHP 8,800 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. He plans to buy a motorcycle one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Tsegmed

texts.en: Tsegmed is 66 years old, lives with his wife in a Han-Uul district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He has two sons, and they are married. Since 1993 Tsegmed has operated a taxi business and in 2004, he started a handicraft business. His wife helps with his business. He makes boxes for earrings, circlet and accessories from felt.   He sells his product in the state department store and other shops. Customers appreciate his products as quality and fashionable. He has been well-experienced and a diligent man. He needs 3,500,000 to purchase some necessary equipments to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary equipments to expand his business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is married and has one child. Avelina is 49 years old. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Avelina plants and harvests bananas and corn for sale to earn a living. She's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Avelina joined GDMPC. In the future, Avelina wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Narcisa is married and has 13 children. To make a living, Narcisa owns & operates transportation services. Narcisa been in her business for 3 years and earns 8,000 a month for these activities. In 2008, Narcisa joined GDMPC. Narcisa is requesting a loan of 16,000 which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin lives Pingol, Ozamiz City. He is 56 years old, married and has three children. For 5 years, he has made a living by providing transportation services, and earns about 10,000 a month from his work. Last 2011, Delfin joined GDMPC. He is applying for this loan for 14,400 to repair his vehicle so he can provide his customers with better service. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by his repaired vehicle to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa is 43 years old, lives with her husband and son, in own apartment  in Bayanzurh district in Ulaanbaatar of Mongolia. Her husband Bolderdene is civil servant, and 43 years old.  Her son's named Odbayasgalan. he is a collage student, and 19 years old. In 2000, she started her cake production business, with her friend and had such is experience. Now she would like to operate her own cake production business alone by herself. She makes 4-5 kind of cakes. She is well known to customers. She has already been many regular customers and suppliers. Also she is planning to make kebab and patty. She is a very hard-working, responsible women. She requesting 4,000,000 MNT, to purchase materials to make cakes.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make cakes

loans.name: Gerson Obed

texts.es: Gerson Obed, de 30 años , soltero sin hijos , su negocio es la venta de zapatos , actividad que inicio hace  6 años, en la actualidad los problemas y desafíos que han enfrenta es la salud de su mama la cual se encuentra enferma, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la localidad, el negocio lo inicio con ayuda de un familiar el cual tiene experiencia en el mismo, debido a necesidad de tener un medio de obtener ingresos propios para  sobrevivir y salir adelante, gracias al apoyo que León 2000 le brinda  y el programa kiva con los financiamientos a los pequeños comerciantes. El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en la compra de zapatos como, tenis, deportivos, sandalias, zapatos de vestir de hombre entre otros.
texts.en:
Gerson Obed is 30 years old. He is single and has no children. His business is in the sale of shoes--a job that he began six years ago. Currently the problems and challenges that he has faced are due to his mother's health, who is now sick. His business is located in his neighborhood market. He began the business with the help of a relative who has experience in this work. 

He did this because of his need to have a means of making his own money to survive and to get ahead. He does this thanks to the support that Leon 2000 and Kiva's  financing has brought him and other small merchants. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of tennis and athletic shoes, sandals and men's dress shoes, among other styles.

loans.use: to buy shoes including tennis shoes, athletic shoes, sandals and men's dress shoes, among other types.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn, 33 years old, is married and has 5 children. She is from Maquilao, Tangub City. For the past 6 years, Rovelyn has provided barbershop services in the local community, earning PHP 6,000 a month.

Rovelyn joined GDMPC in 2008. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase hairdo accessories and materials needed to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hair accessories and materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 52 years old and married with three children. She has one child who is in school. Rose is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

Rose requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Christovel

texts.en:
Christovel, 45 years old, is married to Emilia, also 45 years old. They have been blessed with 3 children: Mega, 12, in 2nd grade of junior high school; Lydia, 10, in 6th grade of elementary school; Andre, 9, in 4th grade of elementary school. 

Christovel owns a shop which is located in a traditional market. When he first began his business, Christovel was only able to provide fertilizer for sale. The business grew little by little and now he is able to sell more items, such as fodder and stationery. Christovel is happy with his business achievements; however, he intends to add farming equipment to his shop because most of the people in this area are farmers who would need this equipment to support their farming activities. To make it happen, Christovel went to TLM’s branch office and applied for a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase farming equipment, such as sickles, hoes, harrows, crowbars, choppers, etc.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment, such as sickles, hoes, harrows, crowbars, choppers, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and has three children aged between 25 and 12 years old. He has 22 solid years in mixed farming, with his major produce including milk, cabbages, coffee and French peas. Julius also runs a butchery business in the local market.

Julius has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank. He says this will enable a supply of water on his farm and the ability to farm in both on and off seasons, and more specifically, banana farming. Julius will channel the major part of his farming income towards his children's education. His  focus is to buy more parcels of land for more expansive coffee farming. Julius says his main challenge remains the low market prices for agricultural products within the local markets. He, however, advocates for the introduction of top-up loans by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora es una mujer muy trabajadora, sigue con su trabajo de costura, el cual ha sido su medio de salir a delante, también elabora piñatas y nacatamales los fines de semana con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos, de sus cuatros hijos, dos de ellos son casados, y dos estudian y viven con ella Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jubilado, recibiendo su pensión.
Su costura es variada, hace por encargo uniformes, vestidos, manteles, una veces el cliente da la tela y otras veces, ella pone todo siendo de un costo más alto su trabajo. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: telas variadas en dacron, gabardina, seda, bordados, hilos. Para seguir ofreciendo su servicio en costura a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pastora is a very hard working woman. She continues with her seamstress work which has been her means of moving forward. She also makes piñatas and Nicaraguan tamales on the weekends in order to receive better earnings. Of her four children two of them are married and two study and live with her. She relies on her husband's help, as he is retired and receiving a pension. 

Her needlework is varied, making made-to-order uniforms, dresses and tablecloths. Sometimes the customer gives her the fabric and other times she does it all, making her work more expensive. With this new loan she will buy varied fabrics of dacron, raincoats, silk, embroidery and threads. This allows her to continue offering her seamstress service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy varied fabrics, threads and needlework to continue offering her seamstress work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lipstick, blush, eye shadows, concealer, eyeliner, gloss, nail polish and body lotions, among others.

loans.name: Anhtuya

texts.en:
Anhtuya, 38 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter in an apartment she owns in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Banzragch, runs a taxi service. Her daughter, Sosorbaram, 16 years old, is a secondary school student.

Since 2009, Anhtuya has run an organic dairy production business. She previously operated a mobile organic dairy production business and now she rents a counter. She is well known to residential customers and has made many regular suppliers and customers. Anhtuya is a friendly and open-minded person. She wants to expand her business in order to increase its income. Anhtuya is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more organic products from herders to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more organic products from herders to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en: Tuvshinjargal is 55 years old and lives with his wife and younger son in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. Tuvshinjargal has a small yard and in this yard he grows organic vegetables. Mongolian summer time is very sunny and very comfortable for growing organic vegetables. He started his own farming and organic vegetable growing business in 2006. He is a hardworking man and says, "I want to expand my business." He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a tractor to carry organic vegetables to the trade center. Tuvshinjargal hopes to increase his business and harvest more organic vegetables to sell. He expects major changes in the improvement of his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor to carry organic vegetables to the trade center.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a 29-year-old man and is married to Marsesi, a 30-year-old woman. They are blessed with a 3-year-old son – Gabriel. A poultry business has been a part of Markus' daily routine in generating income for his beloved family. Prior to running his poultry business, Markus used to run a pig breeding business. At the moment, he has 400 chicks to raise. They will be ready to be sold after 28 days. 

Being aware of the increasing demand for chicken for the Idul Fitri celebration makes Markus eager to add to the number of chicks to raise. He believes that it would improve his business income. Therefore, Markus requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to buy 200 chicks and fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks and fodder for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Maeliz

texts.es: Maeliz , de 33 años de edad , con dos hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad, casada, tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, tiempo de tener el negocio 6 años, Maeliz es muy trabajadora, responsable ella inicio su negocio con capital propio comprando a empresas  cosméticos y vendiéndolo de forma ambulante, en la actualidad su negocio ha prosperado ,el cual tiene un local propio para el negocio, gracia a su esfuerzo tenacidad, ganas de superación de superación personal  ha logrado metas y objetivos personales como, ampliar su negocio y mejorar su casa, y también por la ayuda que León 2000 le ha brindado y el programa kiva con los financiamientos, con el financiamiento comprara mercadería como: camisas, pantalones, short, vestidos, faldas, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en: Maeliz is 33 years old, she has two children who are 7 and 13 years old. She is married. She sells a variety of products for a living. She has had this business for 6 years. Maeliz is a very hard-working and very responsible woman. She started the business with capital of her own, buying cosmetic products from companies and selling them door-to-door. Currently, her business has prospered, and has a store of her own. Thanks to her effort, tenacity and willingness to better herself she has accomplished personal goals, like expanding her business and improving her house. And this was also thanks to the help that León 2000 has provided her, and the Kiva loans financing program. With the loan she will buy merchandise such as: shirts, pants, shirts, dresses, skirts and underwear, among others.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, dresses, skirts and underwear, among others.

loans.name: Shahrikhon

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Shahrikhon works hard to support her family. For the past 8 years, she has operated a successful clothing sales business. She sells women’s and children’s clothes in the local market in her own selling place. As she is a woman with good taste, she has a wide and good assortment of goods, which attract a lot of customers.

Shahrikhon has been sustaining her business activities through her friends. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, Shahrikhon hopes to improve her business in order to provide for her children's education. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy goods for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seasonal women’s clothes

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a 45-year-old widow. From her marriage, she has been blessed with 3 children: 
•	 Irfan, 8, is studying at the 3rd grade of elementary school
•	Homedi, 5, is attending kindergarten
•	Inayah Saputri, 3 
Siti has been engaged in a business selling mobile phones, mobile phone accessories and mobile phone rechargers since 2010. Being friendly and easy going makes Siti get many customers and the business runs smoothly. She is thinking of expanding her business place as it is quite small. She also has a plan to add more goods into the business and is planning to rent a used kiosk. To do so, she applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. The loan would help her to pay for the rental fee and to add more mobile phone accessories and also mobile phone rechargers.

loans.use: to pay for the rental fee and to add more mobile phone accessories and also mobile phone rechargers.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 29 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 12 and 6. She has been actively farming in her rural home area for three years. Farming is her sole source of income, which she uses to meet her family's basic needs. Her farm products are milk and fruits.

Dinah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero-grazing unit for her dairy cows, as well as construct feed storage for them. She says the storage will enable her to buy feeds during the rainy seasons at cheaper costs for her dairy animals. She is optimistic she will be able to educate her children with her farming income.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's services to small farmers and points out pests and diseases as her business challenges.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and feed storage

loans.name: Amorsita

texts.en: Amorsita is 42 years old and married with three children. Amorsita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. Amorsita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing. Amorsita hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia.  Her husband's name is Munhbayar, and he is 32 years old. He works at a gas station. Her older daughter goes to secondary school, and her younger daughter goes to a kindergarden. They are ages 7 and 2 respectively. 

Altantuya started a meat trading business in 2011 with a working capital of 1,500,000 MNT. Now, her working capital has grown up to 2,800,000 MNT. She is hardworking and quiet-natured. She is asking for 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a house.

loans.use: To purchase a house.

loans.name: Yanwar

texts.en:
Yanwar is a 43-year-old motor taxi driver. He is married to Mami, a 32-year-old housewife. They have 3 children: Erson, 13 years old; Erlin, 11 years old; Yelki, 4. All of the children are attending school. Yanwar started his motor taxi business, called ‘Ojek’, several years ago in order to cover his family's needs and to pay the education fees of the children. 

The income generated is unstable and insufficient to fully cover his family's needs. This situation led Yanwar to initiate a new business that is to lease out rooms. Yanwar has 3 empty rooms to lease out but he needs to renovate them. To implement his plan, Yanwar requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000 to be spent on ceramics, sand, cement and wall paint.

loans.use: to buy ceramics, sand, cement and wall paint.

loans.name: Byambadolgor

texts.en:
Byambadolgor, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Zaya, age 32, works in security at a food market. Her son goes to secondary school and her daughter goes to kindergarten.

Byambadolgor started a livestock raw material retail business in 2010 with her sister. She is honest and her family members are hardworking people. Byambadolgor is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase the business' working capital by purchasing meat from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase meat from the countryside

loans.name: Chhaem

texts.en: Chhaem is a farmer living with his family in a suburb of Phnom Penh. He has been farming rice for almost 12 years with support from his wife. He is now 32 years old and has only one child attending school. Chhaem is honest and industrious in his daily duties because he wants to uplift his living conditions and provide for his child's basic needs and education. With his profit from farming, Chhaem plans to invest in raising cows and hogs for better revenue. In order to achieve his business goal, Chhaem has applied for a loan through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase a cow and many piglets to raise. He believes that through his hard work and perseverance he will be able to attain a better standard of living someday.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and many piglets to raise.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a  42-year-old entrepreneur who is living in a simple house with her husband, Philipus, 50 years old, and their 4 children. Isak, 23, is in the university, Margy, 18, is in the 3rd grade of senior high school, Rivaldo, 10, is in the 5th grade of elementary school, and Gabriel is 2 years old.
  
Erna has been running a kiosk business for 3 years. She initiated the business in order to help her husband in generating more income to cover their family needs. Erna plans to expand the business by initiating a brick production business. Erna believes that the income from the business will enable her to support her children, particularly for their education. Therefore Erna applied for a loan of IDR 10,000,000. She would like to spend the loan on cement, sand, brick molds and other supporting equipment.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick molds and other supporting equipment.

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Uon, aged 51, is an industrious mother of five children who are attending school. She pays her full attention to her farming business, from which she is able to provide for her family’s basic necessities. She grows rice and other seasonal crops on her own farmland located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Her husband is very supportive in the maintenance of the fields.

Uon needs additional capital to pay the operating costs of the farming process. For this reason, Uon is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to hire laborers to transplant her rice crop. This will allow her to improve her business and ensure a good harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to hire laborers to transplant her rice crop.

loans.name: Galsanjamts

texts.en:
Galsanjamts lives with a son in a small house in Arhangai province, which is one of the leading organic dairy producers of Mongolia. Galsanjamts is 60 years old. He has been producing organic dairy products since 2005 and he sells them in the center of the province in Ulaanbaatar city.  When he bought three cows in 2010, his yield of milk was improved and increased the volume of production. He purchased a car for his son`s taxi business with his business profit.  

Now Galsanjamts is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a good breed of cows.  In that way, it is possible to produce many kinds of organic dairy products. He is a public and reticent man.

loans.use: To purchase a good breed of cows.

loans.name: Latifjon

texts.en:
Latifjon is an enterprenurial person who is married and has 3 children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years and his business has developed year by year. Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers. He sells his animals in the local market.

Latifjon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. Latifjon is asking for a loan of $1,700 US to buy young cattle to develop his business further. Each month, he will make his payments on time. Latifjon is one of Imon International's best clients and he has a good credit history. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 7 to 14 years old. She describes herself as a committed and aggressive woman. Salome operates a retail store where she sells timber. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located within a competitive area and her primary customers are farmers and construction workers. Salome describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of timber.

Salome will use this KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank for her family and household use. Her business goal is to run a timber factory within 5 years. Salome hopes that, in the future, she will have expanded her business. Salome has previously received 2 loans of KES 20,000 and 2 loans of KES 25,000, which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Bungur Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Misni is running a food stall selling "Gado-gado," an Indonesian vegetable dish. She is married with three children who are 15, 23, and 28 years old. She has been operating her food stall since 1997.  Her business is stable and growing each year, now enjoying a period of seasonal high demand (religious holidays). The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations, inflation and the fact that some customers are not paying on time.

Misni is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 IDR  in order to purchase ingredients such as seasonings, peanuts, vegetables, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to fix her kitchen. Her plans for the future are not only selling gado-gado but clothes also.

loans.use: to purchase gado-gado ingredients.

loans.name: Norbert

texts.en:
Norbert farms to minimize his family's living hardships. This source of income has been a great factor to uplift their living conditions. This causes Norbert to care much for this livelihood. Now that he has his own family, he must double his effort to improve his business.

Norbert is now asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase necessities such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds. He knows that this amount will be a great help in his business. He hopes that his requested amount will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase necessities such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the mother of three children, two of whom are adults with the last being 17 years old and still in school. Rose has been farming for five consecutive years, producing and selling cabbages, carrots, sweet potatoes and milk. She sells her produce to the local market to meet her family's needs. Rose also works as a tailor.

Rose has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter. She plans to expand her dairy farming and construct a zero grazing unit. She wants to diversify crop farming as well. She says that the chuff cutter will ease feeding the dairy animals and reduce wastage of dairy feeds. Rose says that her major challenges are pests and wild animals breaking into the farm.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Florante

texts.en: Florante is 49 years old and married to Jocelyn. For the past 20 years, Florante has been engaged in the farming business. He is thankful for his business because it allows him to provide for his family's necessities. To easily promote his business, he is requesting a 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. He believes he will be able to develop his business and increase his crops through the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two grown children in the village. He has been a farmer for over 25 years and earned 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during the last cropping. His aspiration is to boost up his prior profit. This caused him to request for a loan amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase 2 sacks of rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. His wife and children also help him to lessen his responsibility and work. He hopes through their joint forces and hard work, he can soon gain enough profits to develop their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en: Galbadrah, 49 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his children are in secondary school and kindergarten. Galbadrah started his clothes selling business in 2003, with working capital of 300,000 Mongolian tugrik  (MNT). Now his working capital has raised to 4,600,000 MNT. His business is sustainable. He would like the expand his business by increasing the variety of goods he offers. He needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more goods from Erlian. He is a laborious man who says ''I have a dream to have my own clothing store''.

loans.use: To purchase more goods from Erlian

loans.name: Faizimat

texts.en: Fayzimat is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a person who always finds new ways to earn income.  With the aim of improving the living conditions of his family 20 years ago he began own business deal with animal husbandry. Now he is one of the best and successful businessmen in the local market. He buys cows, cares of them for 2 or 3 months and sells to local people. Thanks to his plodding his cows are fat and attract a lot of customers. He wants to buy more cows for developing the business but does not have the money for it. Also he has additional income from growing crops. He is asking for a loan of 2500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy cows. In this way he will provide his family with a high quality of living conditions. Moreover, he will enter his children in good schools. He promises to make his payment on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor, age 39, has owned and managed his field for almost nine years. He is 39 years old, married to Marvelyn, and blessed with two children. Despite the hardships and difficulties he faces in managing his farm land, he is lucky because he has enough strength to work. He has his family and of course God.

Nestor is requesting a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) as additional capital for his business. He will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make his field more productive. He hopes to increase his profit to save for his children's future and lift his family from poor living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a widowed woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 7 to 18 years old. She describes herself to be a commited and aggressive woman. She operates a dairy farm  where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for ten years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within an agricultural residential area and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the 11,100 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase a water tank for her daily cow and household use. Her business goal is to venture into a business of cereal retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a maize store. Margaret previously had taken a loan of 20,000 KES which she managed to pay.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 46 years old and married with four children, ages 6 to 21 years old. He runs a clothing store in Krootown Center area in Freetown, Sierra Leone.

He's been in this business for 21 years and sells T-shirts, coat material and trousers. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge for his business is insufficient capital to invest in his business.

Mohamed requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more T-shirts, coat material and trousers. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children and improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to import goods from London. He is grateful for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more T-shirts, coat material and trousers.
